Louisiana Scholarships


1825 Scholars Scholarship
Scholarship for incoming freshmen planning to attend Centenary College of Louisiana full-time. Applicants are selected from their essay submitted by February 15th. Notification of awards is made during the week of March 21st. In addition to essay, consideration will be given for high school curriculum, GPA, SAT/ACT scores, extracurricular activities and leadership/service roles. Renewable; maintain 3.0 GPA. more...

2021 Annie Lowe Stiles Scholarship In Nursing, Medical Laboratory Sciences & Occupational Therapy
To qualify for the scholarship, a recipient must meet the following:
A. Enrolled full-time in undergraduate Nursing, undergraduate Medical Laboratory Science, or masterâ€™s degree Occupational Therapy.
B. Student must be enrolled in the clinical/professional phase of their program.
C. Student must be a resident of North Louisiana. more...

5 For 6 Initiative
The 5 for 6 Initiative is available to students at Northwest Louisiana Technical Community College. You must be between 14-26 years of age and have been a foster care recipient to be eligible for this award. more...

A+ Leadership Scholarship
Scholarship for entering freshmen students accepted to Nicholls State University full-time. Applicants must have a high school GPA of at least 2.5 and a minimum ACT score of 20. Candidates should have extensive leadership involvement in high school and/or their community. Number of awards varies. Non-renewable. more...

A. C. Breckenridge Memorial Scholarship
The A. C. Breckenridge Memorial Scholarship was established by the Northeast Louisiana Contractors/A.G.C., Inc. in memory of A. C. Breckenridge, a prominent building contractor in northeast Louisiana.
1. Recipient(s) must be pursuing a degree in Construction.
2. Recipient(s) must have at least a 2.5 Cumulative GPA.
3. To renew the scholarship, the recipient(s) must earn at least a 2.5 Cumulative GPA each semester. more...

A.C. Breckenridge, Jr. Memorial Scholarship
Scholarship for undergraduate or graduate students enrolled full-time at the University of Louisiana-Monroe School of Construction. Deadlines and award amounts may vary. more...

Abell Scholarship
Scholarship for close relatives of current Abell Corporation employees who are undergraduate students enrolled full-time at the University of Louisiana-Monroe. Students who are incoming freshmen must have a minimum B average; upperclass students must have a minimum 3.0 CGPA. Deadlines and award amounts may vary. more...

Abell Scholarship
The Abell Scholarship was established by the Nelson and Bennie Abell family for the benefit of Abell Corporation employees and their families.
1. Recipient(s) must be a close relative of a current employee of Abell Corporation. In the event that Abell Corporation no longer exists, the Nelson Abell family foundation would provide recommendations for the scholarship recipients.
2. For an incoming freshman, the recipient(s) must have a 3.0 GPA graduating from high school.
3. If awarded to an upper class person, the recipient(s) must have a 3.0 CUM GPA on all work pursued to date.
4. Recipient(s) must maintain a 3.0 CUM GPA and his/her close relative must currently be employed with Abell Corporation to renew the scholarship each semester.
5. Recipient selection is based upon personal character, activities, involvement, and good citizenship.
6. The scholarship will be renewable for up to four years or eight semesters. Requests for funding of the scholarship beyond these limits must be submitted in writing to the ULM Foundation and approved by the Abell Corporation. more...

Academic Achievement Scholarship - Centenary College
The Academic Achievement Scholarship is available to entering freshmen at Centenary College. You must have a minimum 2.75 GPA and a minimum 900 SAT / 19 ACT score to be eligible for this award. more...

Academic Departmental Scholarships
Scholarship for undergraduate or graduate students enrolled full-time at McNeese State University. Deadlines and award amounts may vary. more...

Academic Leadership Scholarship
Scholarship for entering freshmen students accepted to Nicholls State University full-time. Applicants must have a high school GPA of at least 3.0 and a minimum ACT score of 22. Number of awards varies. Renewable; maintain 3.0 GPA. more...

Academic-Top 10% Transfer Student Scholarships
Scholarship for transfer students admitted to attend Centenary College of Louisiana full-time. Applicants must rank in the top 10% of their high school class or have had a 3.7 GPA at the time of graduation. Candidates must have completed at least 17 high school core units and obtained an ACT score of 25 or SAT score of 1140. Students must have a minimum 3.0 or greater from all colleges previously attended. Number of awards varies. more...

Academic-Top 20% Transfer Student Scholarships
Scholarship for transfer students admitted to attend Centenary College of Louisiana full-time. Applicants must rank in the top 11-20% of their high school class or have had a 3.5 GPA at the time of graduation. Candidates must have completed at least 17 high school core units and obtained an ACT score of 26 or SAT score of 1180. Students must have a minimum 3.0 or greater from all colleges previously attended. Number of awards varies. more...

Academic-Top 40% Transfer Student Scholarships
Scholarship for transfer students admitted to attend Centenary College of Louisiana full-time. Applicants must rank in the top 21-40% of their high school class or have had a 3.2 GPA at the time of graduation. Candidates must have completed at least 17 high school core units and obtained an ACT score of 27 or SAT score of 1220. Students must have a minimum 3.0 or greater from all colleges previously attended. Number of awards varies. more...

Acadian Ambulance Scholarship
Scholarship for sophomore or higher students attending Nicholls State University full-time, majoring in Emergency Medical Services. Number of awards varies. Non-renewable. more...

Accounting Faculty & Alumni Scholarship
Annual award for undergraduate student attending Southeastern Louisiana University, majoring in Accounting. Applicant must have a minimum 3.0 cumulative GPA, ACT score of at least 20, and participation in extracurricular activities. Due date and award amount varies. Renewable; maintain 3.0 GPA. more...

Ad & Press Club Of Southwest Louisiana Scholarship
Scholarship for undergraduate students enrolled full-time at McNeese State University majoring in Mass Communication, Marketing, or Public Relations. Deadlines and award amounts may vary. more...

Ada Bess Hart Memorial Scholarship
Established by family and friends in memory of Ada Bess Hart. . The purpose is to provide scholarships for deserving students in the Department of Kinesiology.
To qualify for the scholarship, a recipient must meet the following:
A. Recipient(s) must be a full-time student pursuing their first undergraduate degree in Kinesiology.
B. Recipient(s) must have a 2.5 cumulative GPA in college courses and must have completed a minimum of 30 hours.
C. Scholarship is renewable if a 2.5 cumulative GPA is maintained. The scholarship may be renewed for the remaining semesters required to complete a four year degree.
D. Recipient(s) must be an active member of the Association of Students in Kinesiology (ASK). more...

Adam Scott Pecoraro Honors Program Endowed Memorial Scholarship
Annual award for an undergraduate student attending Nicholls State University full-time, enrolled in the Honors Program. Applicant must plan to participate in the summer Study Abroad Program and have the highest cumulative GPA during the spring semester prior to the summer program of all students planning to participate in the program. Upon completion of the Study Abroad Program, recipient must write an essay explaining what the experience meant to him/her. Award amount varies. more...

Addie Lela Thompson Smith Memorial Scholarship
Annual award for graduating high school senior from Kentwood High School in New Orleans, Louisiana who has been accepted to attend Southeastern University, majoring in Accounting. Due date varies. Renewable; maintain 2.5 GPA. more...

Adhd Scholarships
College-bound students who have been diagnosed with ADHD face many challenges. In addition to overcoming a learning disability that makes concentration, problem-solving and impulse control difficult, they face the common obstacle of paying for their post-secondary education. Students with ADHD, or other learning disabilities, can find many scholarship and grant programs dedicated to helping them achieve their goals of a college education. more...

Aep Swepco Foundation Computer Science Scholarship For Graduate Students
1. Must be enrolled in the Master of Computer Systems Technology degree program
2. Must be enrolled in at least 9 graduate credit hours at the time of application
3. Must be enrolled in at least 9 graduate credit hours during the award period
4. Must have a minimum of 3.7 graduate GPA more...

Aep/ Swepco Foundation Computer Science Scholarship For Undergraduate Students
1. Must be enrolled in one of the undergraduate Computer Science degree programs
2. Must be enrolled in at least 12 credit hours at the time of application
3. Must be enrolled in at least 12 credit hours during the award period
4. Must have a minimum of 3.5 undergraduate GPA more...

Recipient must be majoring in a program offered by the School of Agricultural Sciences.
Recipient must have a minimum GPA of 3.0.
Recipient must have a minimum ACT score of 21. more...

Recipient must be majoring in a program offered by the School of Agricultural Sciences.
Recipient must have a minimum GPA of 3.0. more...

Applicant must have a high school GPA of at least 3.5. Award amount varies. more...

Albert J., Jerri H., And David S. Dunn Endowed Scholarship
Albert J. Dunn donated the “Albert J., Jerri H., and David S. Dunn Endowed Scholarship” to Louisiana Tech University.
Student must be registered and remain registered as a full-time student for the quarter in which he/she receives the scholarship at Louisiana Tech University.
Student must be majoring in Civil Engineering.
Students must have a minimum 2.0 GPA.
Preference will be given to students majoring in civil engineering and students from Leesville, Louisiana and Vernon Parish. more...

Alexander J. Berey Endowed Scholarship In Business
Annual award for graduate of a Livingston or Tangipahoa parish high school in Louisiana who is an undergraduate student attending Southeastern Louisiana University full-time, majoring in Business. Applicant must have financial need and a minimum 3.0 GPA. Due date and award amount varies. more...

Alice Powell Anderson Scholarship
Scholarship for undergraduate students attending Loyola University New Orleans. Selection based academic achievement, community involvement and leadership abilities. Due date, number of awards, and award amount may vary. more...

Alice R. Douglas Memorial Scholarship
Annual award for resident of East Baton Rouge Parish, Louisiana who is an undergraduate student attending Southeastern Louisiana University full-time. Applicant must have a minimum 2.5 GPA or better. Due date varies. more...

Allan & Helena Dusenbury Scholarship

Allen B. Thigpen Endowment Memorial Scholarship
This scholarship is established in the memory of Allen B. Thigpen by his family and friends. Allen was a University of Louisiana Monroe Pharmacy Student and a member of the “Sound of Today” Marching Band. The purpose is to provide scholarships for deserving Pharmacy students.
1. Recipient(s) must be a full-time (12 hours or more) student pursuing a degree in Pharmacy.
2. Recipient(s) must have a cumulative GPA of 3.0 or higher.
3. Preference will be given to students from Ouachita Parish area.
4. Scholarship is renewable if a 3.0 GPA is maintained. The scholarship may be renewed up to a maximum of seven semesters for an incoming freshman only. All other classifications will receive the scholarship for the remaining semesters required to complete a four year degree. Should the recipient(s) drop out of the pharmacy program, the scholarship will be awarded to another applicant who meets the criteria for selection.
5. Recipient(s) must demonstrate the high caliber of character and citizenship exemplified by Allen Thigpen. more...

Allen J. Danos, Sr. Memorial Scholarship
Scholarship for graduating high school seniors from a public or private high school who are accepted to Nicholls State University full-time. Applicants must have a minimum 3.25 GPA and a minimum ACT of 18. Home schooled students must have a minimum ACT score of 21. Preference given to dependents of employees of Danos & Curole. Number of awards and award amount varies. more...

Allison Grace Honeycutt Memorial Scholarship
The scholarship shall be named the Allison Grace Honeycutt Memorial Scholarship, established by her parents, Valerie and Blayne, in loving honor and memory of Allison, who passed away on December 20, 2013, at the age of 19. Allison had a gentle caring manner and free-spirited approach to life and was a gift to all who knew her. The purpose of this endowment is to provide scholarships for deserving elementary education students at ULM, her fatherâ€™s undergrad alma mater.
CRITERIA FOR SELECTION:
To qualify for the scholarship, a student must meet the following:
A. Recipient(s) must be a full-time student pursuing a degree in Elementary Education.
B. Recipient(s) must meet university standards for acceptance in the University of Louisiana at Monroe. As an incoming freshman, recipient(s) must have a 2.5 cumulative GPA in high school. A university student must have a 2.5 cumulative GPA in college courses.
C. Scholarship is renewable if the GPA required by the MAT exam is maintained. The scholarship may be renewed up to a maximum of eight semesters for an incoming freshman only. All other classifications may receive the scholarship for the remaining semesters required to complete a four year degree.
D. Recipient(s) must address the following three criteria as completely as possible in a short essay form, giving examples of how he/she meets these criteria:
1. Recipient(s) must be an independent thinker, compassionate and empathetic.
2. Recipient(s) eligibility shall not be biased on race, color, creed or religion, national origin, sexual orientation, marital or parental status, age, handicap, veteran status or political belief.
3. Recipient(s) should possess a free-spirited, non-judgmental attitude similar to Allison, with a love for teaching young children and helping them to love and respect themselves.
*IV. SELECTION OF RECIPIENT: *
The Honeycutt family will review applications and essays, and send recommended recipient(s) name(s) to the University of Louisiana at Monroe Scholarship Committee for final selection(s). The name of recipient(s) shall be forwarded to the Scholarship Office as soon as selection is made. more...

Alma Stark Cecil Scholarship
Annual award for an undergraduate student attending Nicholls State University full-time, majoring in General Family and Consumer Sciences. Applicant must be enrolled in an internship or student teaching, and must be federal work-study eligible. Candidate must have a minimum 2.8 GPA. Award amount varies and is based on need. more...

Althouses Kwik Kopy Printing Scholarship

Alton Mccready Memorial Scholarship
The Alton McCready Memorial Scholarship was established by friends and family to honor the memory of an outstanding businessman, husband, father, and friend to all who knew him. The purpose is to provide scholarships for deserving students in the ULM School of Sciences, in the interests including, but not limited to, the study of physics.
1. Recipient(s) must be a full-time student pursuing a degree in the ULM School of Sciences in programs including, but not limited to, the study of physics.
2. Recipient(s) must meet university standards for acceptance in the University of Louisiana at Monroe. As an incoming freshman, recipient(s) must have a 3.0 cumulative GPA in high school. A university student must have a 3.0 cumulative GPA in college courses.
3. Scholarship is renewable if a 3.0 GPA is maintained. The scholarship may be renewed up to a maximum of eight semesters for an incoming freshman only. All other classifications may receive the scholarship for the remaining semesters required to complete a four-year degree.
4. Recipient(s) must exhibit qualities of integrity and high moral character as personified by Alton McCready.
Current majors that fall under ULM School of Sciences: Atmospheric Science, Biology and Mathematics. more...

Selection Criteria:
Recipient must be a student within the College of Business. more...

Am Vets Post 66 Scholarship
The Amvets Post 66 Scholarship was established by the local organization to provide scholarships for deserving descendants of American veterans.
1. Recipient(s) must be a full-time student who is a family member of an American veteran, pursuing an undergraduate or graduate degree. If no candidate meets this criteria, the scholarship could be applied by an American allied veterans descendants.
2.. As an incoming freshman, recipient(s) must have a 2.5 cumulative GPA in high school. A university student must have a 2.5 cumulative GPA in college courses.
3. Scholarship is renewable if 2.5 GPA is maintained. The scholarship may be renewed up to a maximum of seven semesters for an incoming freshman only. All other classifications will receive the scholarship for the remaining semesters required to complete a four year degree. more...

Amos Lee And Corrie E. Armstrong Endowment Scholarship
Don Kennedy served as Executor for his cousin Corrie E. Armstrong and was involved in establishing the “Amos Lee and Corrie E. Armstrong Scholarship Endowment” for Louisiana Tech University. Corrie held an interest in supporting a graduate of Farmerville High School with preference with students studying in education or medicine. If a year does not have enough candidates studying in education or medicine, the scholarship can be awarded to students pursuing degrees in other academic years.
First preference to students from Union Parish High School in the upper 20% of their graduating class intending to major in Education or Medicine
Applicants should be nominated by three Union Parish High School faculty member. more...

Amy Katherine Lewis Student Award Endowment In Medical Laboratory Science
To qualify for the scholarship, a recipient must meet the following:
A. Recipient(s) must be a full-time student that is in good standing in the MLS professional program.
B. Recipient(s) must have and maintain a 2.5-3.0 GPA in the MLS professional program to receive the scholarship.
C. Recipient(s) must be a junior applying for scholarships for their senior year in the MLS professional program. The scholarship for incoming seniors may be awarded to the same student for a maximum of two semesters. more...

Anna Meyer Endowment Trust Fund
The scholarship has been named the Anna Meyer Endowment Trust Fund established by the officers and trustees of the Anna R. Meyer Charities in honor and in memory of Anna Meyer. The purpose is to provide scholarships for deserving students.
To qualify for the scholarship, a student must meet the following:
A. Recipient(s) must be a resident of Ouachita Parish.
B. Donor’s intent is to assist students who have a financial need as evidenced by the Student Aid Report (SAR) received by the university after the FAFSA process is complete each year and who might otherwise be unable to attend college without this scholarship. Students who are eligible for federal educational grants which do not have to be repaid, such as Federal Pell Grants, are not eligible for this scholarship, absent very extenuating circumstances. The Admissions Office shall have the latitude to make such a decision keeping in mind the original intent of this donation.
C. Recipient(s) may be a full-time or part-time student pursuing their first undergraduate degree and must meet university standards for acceptance in the University of Louisiana at Monroe.
D. Scholarship is renewable if a 2.5 GPA is maintained. The scholarship may be renewed up to a maximum of eight semesters for an incoming freshman only. All other classifications may receive the scholarship for the remaining semesters required to complete a four-year degree. more...

Anna Meyer First Generation Endowed Undergraduate Scholarship
To qualify for the scholarship, a student must meet the following:
Recipient(s) must be a resident of Louisiana
Be a first-generation college student (your parents or guardians never earned a college degree) with financial need after the EFC (Estimated Family Contribution) and grants/scholarships are deducted or be a student, whether first-generation or not, who has been awarded the federal Pell grant and is admitted to the university during the semester(s) that the awards are disbursed.
Recipient(s) must meet university standards for acceptance at the University of Louisiana Monroe, must be admitted to the university, and must be pursuing their first undergraduate degree.
Scholarship may be renewed if a minimum 2.5 cumulative GPA is maintained. The scholarship may be renewed up to a maximum of seven semesters for an incoming freshman only.
All other classifications will receive the scholarship for the remaining semesters required to complete a four-year degree. more...

Anna Prothro Art Scholarship
Billy Ray Prothro donated the “Anna Prothro Art Scholarship” to Louisiana Tech University.
Selection Criteria:
The scholarship recipient must be registered and remain registered as a full-time student for the quarter in which he/she receives the scholarship at Louisiana Tech University.
The scholarship will be awarded to a student in the School of Design majoring in graphic design, interior design, studio, OR architecture.
The scholarship recipient must maintain at least a minimum 3.5 GPA in all official college courses. more...

Selection Criteria:
The scholarship recipient(s) must be registered and remain registered as a full-time student for the quarter in which he/she receives the scholarship at Louisiana Tech University.
The scholarship shall be awarded to a student majoring in an English curriculum who has demonstrated a proficiency in creative writing.
The scholarship recipient must maintain at least a minimum 3.5 GPA in all official college courses. more...

1. Recipient(s) must be studying the German Language. In the event that there are no satisfactory candidates wishing to study the German Language, students pursuing studies in other languages will be considered.
2. Scholarship recipient may continue scholarship if they remain in Foreign Language studies and maintain a B average. more...

Annie Lowe Stiles Health Science Scholarship
CRITERIA FOR SELECTION:
A. The recipient must be a full-time Junior, Senior or Graduate Student enrolled in the clinical phase of the bachelor degree programs undergraduate Nursing, undergraduate Medical Laboratory Science, or masterâ€™s degree in Occupational Therapy.
B. Student must be enrolled in the clinical/professional phase of their program
C. Student must be a resident of North Louisiana
D. Recipient(s) must meet university standards for acceptance in the University of Louisiana Monroe and have a minimum college GPA of 3.2.
E. To maintain the scholarship for a second semester, the awardee must be enrolled full-time towards their degree with a minimum GPA of 3.2 during the last semester of enrollment and remain in the major. more...

The student must be majoring within the College of Engineering and Science.

Katherine A. Scharer and David H. Scharer established the Arbuthnot-Scharer Endowed Scholarship for the students at Louisiana Tech University.

Recipient must be an Incoming Freshman.
Recipient must have a minimum 3.0 High School GPA.
Recipient must not have an ACT composite score of more than 22.
First Preference is given to students from Catahoula Parish.
Second Preference is given to students enrolled in the COB. more...

Recipient must have a minimum 3.0 High School GPA.

Armed Forces Comm. And Electronics Association Scholarship - Lsu
The Armed Forces Communication and Electronics Association Scholarship is available to junior Air Force ROTC cadets at Louisiana State University. You must be majoring in a computer- or mathematics-related discipline to be eligible for this award. more...

Arrant Scholarship In Insurance

Arthur & Esther Devries Scholarship
Scholarship for undergraduate juniors or above (including graduate students) attending Southeastern Louisiana University full-time, enrolled in the Department of Kenesiology and Health Studies. Applicants must have a minimum 3.0 GPA or better. Due date, number of awards and award amount varies. more...

Arthur J. Wilson, Iii National Defense Scholarship In Engineering
Gina Wilson donated the “Arthur J. Wilson III, National Defense Scholarship in Engineering” to Louisiana Tech University to assist students in paying for tuition, laboratory fees, books, dorm fees, cafeteria fees, and any equipment necessary for engineering studies.
Selection Criteria:
The scholarship recipient must be registered and remain registered as a full-time student for each quarter in which he/she receives the scholarship at Louisiana Tech University.
The scholarship recipient must maintain a minimum 2.5 GPA in all official college courses.
First preference in awarding the scholarship will be to a mechanical engineering student who has served or is serving in any military branch.
Second preference will be a student majoring in mechanical engineering who is a member of the ROTC.
Third preference will be a student majoring in mechanical engineering who has worked or is working for a defense contractor. more...

Arthur L. Griffith Major Impact Scholarship
To qualify for the scholarship, a student must meet the following:
A. The recipient may be a full-time or part-time student enrolled at ULM in one of the programs under the David and Sharon Turrentine School of Management.
B. Scholarship is renewable if the recipient maintains a minimum 3.0 GPA while under the scholarship award. The scholarship may be renewed up to a maximum of seven semesters for an incoming freshman only. All other classifications may receive the scholarship for the remaining semesters required to complete a four year degree.
C. Donor’s intent is to assist students who have a financial need as evidenced by the Student Aid Report (SAR) received by the university after the FAFSA process is complete each year and who might otherwise be unable to attend college without this scholarship. Students who are eligible for federal educational grants that do not have to be repaid, such as Federal Pell Grants, are not eligible for this scholarship, absent very extenuating circumstances. The Admissions Office shall have the latitude to make such a decision keeping in mind the original intent of this donation.
The University of Louisiana Monroe Scholarship Committee will make scholarship awards. more...

Aspiring Gerontologist Education (Age) Scholarship
Aspiring Gerontologist Education (AGE) Scholarship was established by family and friends in honor/memory of Mrs. Krishna Sharma. The purpose is to provide scholarships in the form of tuition fee payments for deserving Gerontology graduate students based on merit and need.
To qualify for the scholarship, a student must meet the following:
A. The recipient must be a full-time or part-time :
undergraduate student, with Senior classification, officially admitted into the ULM Gerontology Graduate Program in the spring/summer semester of the year he/she will begin their graduate program of study. OR
a non-traditional student returning to college after a long gap to enroll in the Gerontology graduate program; OR
student who dropped out of graduate school and wants to complete his/her graduate degree in Gerontology.
B. Recipient(s) must meet university standards for acceptance into the Graduate School at the University of Louisiana Monroe. A university student, to be accepted into the Graduate School at ULM, must have a minimum of 2.6 cumulative GPA in his/her undergraduate degree.
C. Scholarship is renewable if a 3.5 GPA is maintained in the Gerontology Graduate Program. The scholarship may be renewed to pay towards the tuition fee for up to a maximum of two years if the student is not able to pay the fee to stay enrolled in the Gerontology Graduate Program.
D. The recipient needs to be a US Citizen or a legal US Permanent Resident.
E. Preference will be given to:
students who may drop out of graduate school due to financial hardships;
non-traditional students returning to college after a long gap to enroll in the Gerontology graduate program; and
students who dropped out of graduate school and want to complete their graduate degree in Gerontology. more...

The Gilman Scholarship Program is a program of the U.S. Department of State’s Bureau of Educational and Cultural Affairs, and is assisted in its implementation by the Institute of International Education (IIE). The Gilman Program provides grants for undergraduate U.S. citizens of limited financial means to study and intern abroad, thereby gaining skills critical to our national security and economic prosperity. more...

Brookshire’s Super 1 Foods Scholarship
A. Recipient(s) may be a full-time or part-time student pursuing a degree in one or more of the following areas: Business Administration, Masters of Business Administration (MBA), Management, Marketing, Accounting, Finance, Computer Information Systems, Computer Science, Communications, Master of Arts Communications (MA), Pre-Pharmacy, Doctor of Pharmacy (PharmD), and Doctor of Philosophy in Pharmacy (Ph.D.).
B. As an incoming freshman, recipient(s) must have a 2.5 minimum cumulative GPA in high school. A university student must have a 2.5 minimum cumulative GPA in college courses.
C. Scholarship is renewable if a 2.5 minimum GPA is maintained. The scholarship may be renewed up to a maximum of eight semesters for an incoming freshman only. All other classifications may receive the scholarship for the remaining semesters required to complete a four-year degree.
D. Needs-based. Donor(s) intent is to assist students who have a financial need as evidenced by the Student Aid Report (SAR) received by the university after the FAFSA process is complete each year and who might otherwise be unable to attend college without this scholarship. Students eligible for federal educational grants that do not have to be repaid, such as Federal Pell Grants, are not eligible for this scholarship, absent very extenuating circumstances. The Admissions Office shall have the latitude to make such a decision keeping in mind the original intent of this donation. more...

Bruce Mouton Endowed Scholarship
Scholarship for Lafayette or Vermilion Parish, Louisiana residents who are undergraduate (freshmen ineligible) enrolled full-time at the University of Louisiana-Lafayette Department of Chemistry majoring in Pre-Pharmacy or Nursing. Students must have a minimum 2.5 GPA and be U.S. citizens. Applicants who are Pre-Pharmacy majors must be sophomores; Nursing majors must be juniors or seniors. Due date and number of awards may vary. more...

Bryan Family Scholarship
Kathleen H. Bryan Scholarship donated by Richard Bryan to Louisiana Tech University for students majoring in the School of Performing Arts.
Selection Criteria:
The scholarship is designated to the School of Performing Arts and will be awarded by the Director of the School of Performing Arts and or his designee(s).
The scholarship recipient(s) must be registered and remain registered as a full-time student for the quarter in which he/she receives the scholarship at Louisiana Tech University.
The scholarship recipient(s) must be registered and remain as a full time student for the quarter they receive the scholarship at Louisiana Tech University.
Scholarship(s) will be awarded annually, with disbursement quarterly
The scholarship shall be intended to assist the recipient(s) in paying any college cost that would otherwise be paid to Louisiana Tech University by the student.
The donor request the the scholarship be awarded where it is needed most and can provide the greatest benefit. more...

Today, this support continues as IHS seeks the next generation of leaders committed to improving the health of Indian communities. more...

The scholarship shall be awarded to a student whose intent is to attend medical school.
The scholarship recipient must have a minimum 3.75 GPA in all official college courses to be awarded the scholarship.
The scholarship shall be awarded to a junior or senior student.
The scholarship applicant shall write a letter to the scholarship awards committee detailing his/her needs for the scholarship and why he/she is pursuing a career in medicine.
First preference in awarding the scholarship shall be given to students from Lincoln Parish who graduated from a high school in Lincoln Parish and who meet all other criteria. more...

Caldwell Parish Morris Endowed Scholarship
To qualify for the scholarship, a recipient must meet the following:
A. Recipient(s) must be a full-time student and in good standing with the University.
B. Recipient(s) must have a high school 3.0 cumulative GPA and must also include a 3.0 GPA in high school English to receive the scholarship.
C. The scholarship must be awarded to an incoming freshman having graduated from Caldwell Parish High School. The scholarship is not renewable.
D. The scholarship shall be intended to assist the recipient(s) in paying any college education costs that would otherwise be paid to The University of Louisiana Monroe by the student. Donor’s intent is to assist students who have a financial need as evidenced by the Student Aid Report (SAR) received by the university after the FAFSA process is complete each year and who might otherwise be unable to attend college without this scholarship.
E. Recipient(s) must address the following two criteria as completely as possible in a short essay form, giving examples of how he/she meets these criteria:
a. What does the recipient(s) plan to do with his/her college education?
b. A general statement of the recipient(s) financial need. more...

To qualify for the scholarship, a student must meet the following:
A. The recipient must be a full-time student pursuing their first undergraduate degree in a discipline in the Arts, Humanities, or Sciences.
B. The university student must have a 3.5 cumulative GPA in college courses and junior standing with the scholarship to be awarded during the recipient’s senior year.
C. Scholarship is not renewable.
D. Submission of a formal one-page essay reflecting on the importance of the student’s chosen discipline and future goals and an accompanying c.v. with college service, awards and honors is required.

To qualify for the scholarship, a student must meet the following:
Recipient(s) must be a resident of Louisiana
Be a first-generation college student (your parents or guardians never earned a college degree) with financial need after the EFC (Estimated Family Contribution) and grants/scholarships are deducted or be a student, whether first-generation or not, who has been awarded the federal Pell grant and is admitted to the university during the semester(s) that the awards are disbursed.
Recipient(s) must meet university standards for acceptance at the University of Louisiana Monroe, must be admitted to the university, and must be pursuing their first undergraduate degree.
Scholarship may be renewed if a minimum 2.5 cumulative GPA is maintained. The scholarship may be renewed up to a maximum of seven semesters for an incoming freshman only.
All other classifications will receive the scholarship for the remaining semesters required to complete a four-year degree.
Recipient(s) must have a minimum ACT score of 21 and a 3.0 high school GPA.

Cecil Brown Memorial Endowed Scholarship Fund
The Cecil Brown Memorial Endowed Scholarship was established by family and friends in honor and in memory of Cecil Brown. The purpose is to provide scholarships for deserving students.
To qualify for the scholarship, a student must meet the following:
1. Recipient(s) may be a full-time or part-time student pursuing their first undergraduate degree.
2. Recipient(s) must meet university standards for acceptance in the University of Louisiana at Monroe. As an incoming freshman, recipient(s) must have a 2.5 cumulative GPA in high school. A university student must have a 2.5 cumulative GPA in college courses.
3. Scholarship is renewable if a 2.5 GPA is maintained. The scholarship may be renewed up to a maximum of seven semesters for an incoming freshman only. All other classifications may receive the scholarship for the remaining semesters required to complete a four year degree.
4. Preference will be given to students from Franklin Parish. If there are no applicants from Franklin Parish, the donor’s request is that this scholarship shall be made available to all student applicants who are in good standing with the university. After review of applicant(s) by Cecil Brown’s family, the University of Louisiana at Monroe Scholarship Committee shall use its best judgment for initial selection of recipient(s) and their eligibility for renewal of the scholarship award. There shall be no restrictions regarding the student applicant’s classification, major, pursuit of degree, geographics or demographics. more...

Cenla Alumni Chapter Educational Scholarship
Established in 2003 as an annual scholarship by the alumni and supporters of ULM to provide scholarships for deserving students attending ULM from the CENLA Alumni Chapter area.
1. Preference shall be given to first and second semester freshmen.
2. Recipient(s) shall have attained at least a 3.0 GPA in high school and must have a score of 21 or higher on the ACT Test; for a student currently enrolled in ULM, the student must have at least a 2.5 GPA and be considered a student in good standing with ULM.
3. Recipient(s) must have graduated from a high school in the CENLA Alumni Chapter area or achieved the equivalent through & home schooling.
4. The recipient’s parent(s) or legal guardian must have a permanent residence in the CENLA Alumni Chapter area on the date application is made for the scholarship and as of the date of approval of the scholarship.
(Permanent residence is defined as living in the defined parishes more than fifty percent (50%) of the most recent calendar year. The CENLA Alumni Chapter area is hereby defined as the parishes of Avoyelles, Grant, and Rapides.)
5. Scholarship is not renewable. more...

Scholarship for undergraduate students attending Centenary College of Louisiana full-time. Applicants must meet all State requirements for TOPS, as well as the following: ACT score of at least 22; GPA of 2.5 or higher; must have completed 16.5 core units; and file the FAFSA application. Due date and number of awards varies. Reneweable; must maintain 2.5 GPA. more...

Centenary T.O.P.S. Scholarship
Scholarship for incoming freshmen students attending Centenary College of Louisiana full-time. This award supplements the TOPS funds of forty selected students with institutional funding to raise a students total financial package to the level of full tuition. Student must meet all basic State requirements for TOPS, as well as: ACT score of 27; GPA of 3.5; file the FAFSA; have completed 16.5 core units. Number of awards and award amount varies. Renewable; maintain 3.0 GPA. more...

Charles Allen Endowed Scholarship In Biology
To qualify for the scholarship, a recipient must meet the following:
A. Recipient(s) may be a full-time or part-time student pursuing a degree in Biology.
B. As an incoming freshman, recipient(s) must have a 2.75 minimum cumulative GPA in high school. A university student must have a 2.75 minimum cumulative GPA in college courses.
C. Scholarship is renewable if a 2.75 minimum GPA is maintained. The scholarship may be renewed up to a maximum of eight semesters for an incoming freshman only. All other classifications may receive the scholarship for the remaining semesters required to complete a four-year degree.
D. Scholarship awards are needs-based. The intent is to assist students who have a financial need as evidenced by the Student Aid Report (SAR) received by the university after the FAFSA process is complete each year and who might otherwise be unable to attend college without this scholarship. Students who are eligible for federal educational grants which do not have to be repaid, such as Federal Pell Grants, are not eligible for this scholarship, absent very extenuating circumstances. The Admissions Office shall have the latitude to make such a decision keeping in mind the original intent of this donation. more...

Charles M. Anderson Memorial Scholarship
Scholarship for undergraduate students enrolled full-time at McNeese State University majoring in Biological Sciences with a Pre-medical concentration. Deadlines and award amounts may vary. more...

Charles Mcdonald Ulm Retiree Scholarship
The scholarship shall be named the Charles H. (Charlie Mac) McDonald – ULM Retirees Scholarship, established by Charlie Mac and retirees of the University of Louisiana at Monroe. The purpose is to provide scholarships for deserving children and grandchildren of ULM retirees.
To qualify for the scholarship, a student must meet the following:
1. Recipient(s) may be a full-time or part-time student pursuing their first undergraduate degree.
2. As an incoming freshman, recipient(s) must have a 2.5 cumulative GPA in high school. A university student must have a 2.5 cumulative GPA in college courses.
3. Scholarship may be renewable if a 2.5 GPA is maintained, but a new application will be required and reviewed annually. The scholarship may be renewed up to a maximum of seven semesters for an incoming freshman only. All other classifications will receive the scholarship for the remaining semesters required to complete a four year degree.
4. Preference will be given to children or grandchildren of retirees of the University of Louisiana at Monroe. more...

Scholarship for undergraduate students attending Loyola University New Orleans who are majoring in Music (vocal). Selection based academic achievement and musical talent. Due date, number of awards, and award amount may vary. more...

Applicant must plan to study abroad and must return to Southeastern for at least one semester after summer abroad study. Applicant must have completed at least 54 credit hours if undergraduate student or 9 hours if graduate student. Candidate must have a minimum 3.0 GPA. Due date and award amount varies. more...

Claire Lee Chennault Memorial Aviation Scholarship
Established by family, friends, colleagues, and the Alpha Eta Rho Professional Aviation Fraternity in 1972 in honor and memory of General Claire Lee Chennault. The purpose is to provide scholarships for deserving students.
The scholarship, once awarded, is for a full four year period, subject, however, to the following:
A. Recipient(s) must be pursuing a degree in Aviation.
B. Recipient(s) must maintain at least a 2.5-grade point average each semester. A GPA below 3.0 may be cause for a re-evaluation of the award, depending on the circumstances.
C. Recipient(s) must demonstrate merit, capability, physical condition, and aeronautical adaptability commensurate with requirements of the Aviation program.
D. Recipient(s) must have appropriate standards of character and responsibility.
E. Recipient(s) must be recommended for the program by persons who are familiar with them other than their immediate family. more...

College Of Arts, Education & Sciences Scholarship Fund
NAME AND PURPOSE:
The scholarship has been named the College of Arts, Education & Sciences Scholarship Fund, established by alumni and friends of the College of Arts, Education & Sciences. The purpose is to provide scholarships for deserving students in the College of Arts, Education & Sciences.
CRITERIA FOR SELECTION:
To qualify for the scholarship, a student must meet the following:
A. Recipient(s) may be a full-time or part-time student pursuing their first undergraduate degree in the College of Arts, Education & Sciences.
B. As an incoming freshman, recipient(s) must have a 2.5 cumulative GPA in high school. A university student must have a 2.5 cumulative GPA in college courses.
SELECTION OF RECIPIENT:
The College of Arts, Education & Sciences Scholarship Committee will send recommended recipient(s) name(s) to the University of Louisiana at Monroe Scholarship Committee for final selection. The name of recipient(s) shall be forwarded to the Scholarship Office as soon as selection is made. more...

Student must remain within the College of Business or the scholarship will no longer apply.

College Of Health Sciences Endowed Scholarship Fund For Medical Laboratory Science
NAME AND PURPOSE:
The scholarship shall be named the College of Health Sciences Endowed Scholarship for Medical Laboratory Science (MLS) established by alumni and friends of the College of Health and Pharmaceutical Sciences. The purpose is to provide scholarships for deserving senior students in the MLS program in the College of Health and Pharmaceutical Sciences.
CRITERIA FOR SELECTION:
To qualify for the scholarship, a student must meet the following:
A. The recipient must be a full-time student pursuing their first undergraduate degree in the College of Health Sciences.
B. The recipient must be a senior in the MLS program in the College of Health Sciences and have a cumulative GPA of 2.75 and a 3.0 GPA in MLS.
SELECTION OF RECIPIENT:
The MLS Scholarship Committee and the College of Health Sciences Scholarship Committee will send recommended recipient(s) name(s) to the University of Louisiana at Monroe Scholarship Committee for final selection(s). The name of recipient(s) shall be forwarded to the Scholarship Office as soon as selection is complete. more...

Community Service Fellowship
The Community Service Fellowship is available to entering freshmen at Tulane University. You must demonstrate high academic achievement as well as outstanding dedication to serving the community with leadership, passion, peer engagement, and resourcefulness to be eligible for this renewable award. If selected as a fellow, you will join a cohort of active and engaged Fellows on campus, attend monthly group meetings, complete approximately 100 service/leadership hours a year, and learn to be a dynamic leader and community advocate. more...

Como Charitable Foundation Annual Scholarship
To qualify for the scholarship, a recipient(s) must meet the following:
A. The recipient(s) must be from Franklin Parish.
B. Recipient(s) must meet university standards for acceptance in the University of Louisiana Monroe for either undergraduate or graduate programs.
C. COMMUNITY SERVICE. Documentation of recent service hours an applicant has volunteered to the organization(s)* that promote(s) the quality of life for others in Franklin Parish will be a favorable factor used by the Scholarship Committee to grant a scholarship as well as to determine the amount of a scholarship. Please note that services for Franklin Parish organizations will be given greater weight although any recent community service rendered by an applicant will be considered.
D. RENEWAL OF SCHOLARSHIPS. A scholarship is not automatically renewable but must be applied for on an annual basis. However, a scholarship may be renewable if a student maintains a 2.5 GPA.
1. Four-Year Program. A scholarship may be renewed up to a maximum of seven semesters for incoming freshmen pursuing a four-year degree.
2. Five-Year Program. A scholarship may be renewed up to a maximum of nine semesters for incoming freshmen pursuing a five-year degree.
3. Graduate Program. A scholarship may be renewed for the number of semesters required by ULM for a graduate student to complete their respective graduate degree.
4. All other classifications may receive the scholarship for the remaining semesters required to complete a four-year degree.
5. Evidence of service as indicated in III © above will be a favorable factor in the Committee’s decision to renew scholarships and to determine the amount of each scholarship.
6. Recipient(s) are strongly encouraged to provide a report after each semester of scholarship award to the ULM Scholarship Committee via upload through the Scholarship portal detailing service hours they provided to an organization(s)* that promote the quality of life in Franklin Parish.
*Suggested service organizations: Winnsboro Main Street, Princess Theatre, Good Samaritans of Franklin Parish, Project Change of Franklin Parish, Franklin Parish Black Achievers more...

Completer's Grant
The Board of Regents has approved for a limited time, a new financial aid framework, the Completers Grant, which is designed to incentivize near-completers in all majors especially to those in high demand fields such as teacher education, healthcare and Science, Technology, Engineering, and Math (STEM) at Louisiana’s public two- and four-year institutions to earn their undergraduate degrees and to incentivize enrollment in and completion of short-term credential programs at two-year institutions. All degree programs are eligible for funding assistance. The Completers Grant will provide grants to students who have completed at least 90 credit hours toward their declared bachelor’s degree, have completed at least 30 credit hours toward their declared associate degree, or who are completing an on-ramp credential and/or credential of value programs as identified by Louisiana Workforce Commission. The Louisiana Office of Student Financial Assistance (LOSFA) will administer this grant program which is being funded using one-time Governor’s Emergency Education Relief (GEER) Fund dollars which are only available for Fall 2022, Spring 2023 and Summer 2023 terms.
To be eligible for the Completers Grant, a student must:
Be a Louisiana resident.
Meet ULM Satisfactory Academic Progress policy requirements.
Complete an online application.
Be eligible to receive funds through CARES Act/CRRSA Act/ARP Act.

FAFSA is no longer required but may be required if need is questionable.
Students must take classes within their degree plan to be considered.
Students must be enrolled through the 14th class day at the hours awarded to maintain the amount awarded or keep the amount awarded all together. If the student drops or changes their schedule before the 14th class day, their Completers amount will be cancelled or adjusted.
• And meet one of the following:
Have completed at least 90 credit hours toward their declared bachelor’s degree program.
Have completed at least 30 credit hours toward their declared associate degree program.
Be enrolled in an on-ramp credential and/or short-term credential of value program as identified by the Louisiana Workforce Commission. For credit programs – students shall meet the enrolling institution’s Satisfactory Academic Progress (SAP) policy. For non-credit programs – students shall successfully complete course(s) sufficient to continue in their program of study as determined by the institution. more...

Cybercorps Scholarship For Service (Sfs)
Scholarship For Service (SFS) is a unique program designed to increase and strengthen the cadre of federal information assurance professionals that protect the government’s critical information infrastructure. This program provides scholarships that may fully fund the typical costs incurred by full-time students while attending a participating institution, including tuition and education and related fees. The scholarships are funded through grants awarded by the National Science Foundation. (NSF)
Selection Criteria:
Student must be a junior or senior in CSC or CYEN.
Student must be a U.S. Citizen.
Student must have a 3.20 cumulative GPA. more...

Applicant must have a minimum 2.5 GPA and cannot be receiving any other awards. Award amount varies. more...

Cynthia Ann Clark Thompson Scholarship
Cynthia Ann Clark was a student in the College of Business and Administration at Louisiana Tech. Both she and her husband had to work long hours to pay for school and living costs while pursuing their degrees. The purpose of the “Cynthia Ann Clark Thompson Scholarship” is to help students who are also working their way through college.
A student must be pursuing one of the degrees offered by the School of Professional Accountancy.
Normally a student must have and maintain a 2.5 GPA or higher.
Student is eligible if they: a) do not live with parents and therefore have higher living costs. b) have greater financial need than others being considered c) have classifications in the following preferred order: seniors, juniors, graduate student, sophomore, freshman d) have qualities appropriate to the accounting profession. more...

Cynthia Ann Luffey Endowed Scholarship

Recipient must have a minimum 3.0 High School GPA.

Cynthia Colon Gay Memorial Scholarship

D Rak Foundation Scholarship
To qualify for the scholarship, a recipient must meet the following:
A. Recipient(s) must be a student athlete involved with baseball or football.
B. Scholarship may be used as a recruiting tool for baseball or football at the discretion of the ULM Baseball Coach, ULM Football Coach, and the ULM Athletic Director.
C. Scholarship is not renewable.
D. Needs based. Donors’ intent is to assist students who have a financial need as evidenced by the Student Aid Report (SAR) received by the university after the FAFSA process is complete each year and who might otherwise be unable to attend college without this scholarship. Students who are eligible for federal educational grants which do not have to be repaid, such as Federal Pell Grants, are not eligible for this scholarship, absent very extenuating circumstances. The Admissions Office shall have the latitude to make such a decision keeping in mind the original intent of this donation.
The University of Louisiana Monroe Scholarship Office will work with the ULM Baseball Coach, the ULM Football coach, and the ULM Athletic Director where appropriate to award the scholarship based upon this governing criteria. more...

Dallas Leroy & Helen D. Calmes Memorial Scholarship

David & Sharon Turrentine Opportunity Scholarship
To qualify for the scholarship, a student must meet the following:
A. The recipient may be a full-time or part-time student enrolled at ULM pursuing a degree or certificate in one of the programs under the David and Sharon Turrentine School of Management.
B. Scholarship is not renewable.
C. Preference is to assist students who have a financial need as evidenced by the Student Aid Report (SAR) received by the university after the FAFSA process is complete each year and who might otherwise be unable to attend college without this scholarship. Students who are eligible for federal educational grants that do not have to be repaid, such as Federal Pell Grants, are not eligible for this scholarship, absent very extenuating circumstances. The Admissions Office shall have the latitude to make such a decision keeping in mind the original intent of this donation.
The Director of the David and Sharon Turrentine School of Management will select award amounts and recipients and report the selections to the ULM Scholarship Office for awarding. more...

David Baughman, Dds, Md Doctorate Of Pharmacy Scholarship Endowment
The David Baughman, DDS, MD Doctorate of Pharmacy Scholarship Endowment was established by David Baughman, DDS, MD. The purpose is to provide scholarships for deserving Pharm.D. students.
To qualify for the scholarship, a student must meet the following:
A. Recipient(s) must be a full-time student pursuing a Doctorate of Pharmacy.
B. Recipient(s) must meet university standards for acceptance in the University of Louisiana at Monroe Pharmacy School.
C. Recipient(s) must comply with standards of the ULM Pharmacy School.
D. Recipient(s) must be a citizen of the United States at the time of receiving the scholarship.
SELECTION OF RECIPIENT:
The College of Health and Pharmaceutical Sciences Scholarship Committee will send recommended recipient(s) name(s) to the University of Louisiana at Monroe Scholarship Committee for final selection(s). The name of the recipient(s) shall be forwarded to the Scholarship Office as soon as a selection is made. more...

Dean Thomas E. Murphy Water Ski Scholarship
The scholarship shall be named the Dean Thomas E. Murphy Water Ski Scholarship, established by family and friends of Thomas E. Murphy in honor and in memory of his leadership and commitment to the NLU Division of Student Affairs from 1965 to 1992; his tireless dedication to the ULM Water Ski Team, which under his leadership, became the most successful collegiate program in the United States; and his contributions to the National Collegiate Water Ski Association with innovations that afforded opportunities to more student athletes. The purpose is to provide scholarships for deserving students.
1. Recipient(s) must be a full time student participating in collegiate waterskiing.
2. As an incoming freshman, recipient(s) must have a 2.5 cumulative GPA in high school. A university student must have a 2.5 cumulative GPA in college courses.
3. Scholarship is renewable if a 2.5 GPA average is maintained. Recipient(s) must maintain adequate progress toward a degree. The scholarship may be renewed up to a maximum of eight semesters for an incoming freshman only. All other classifications may receive the scholarship for the remaining semesters required to complete a four year degree.
4. Recipient(s) must demonstrate the qualities of character and leadership.
5. Recipient(s) must exemplify dedication, teamwork and display outstanding promise or ability in competitive waterskiing. more...

Dean Van Mcgraw Endowed Scholarship
To qualify for the scholarship, a recipient must meet the following:
A. Recipient(s) must be a full-time American student pursuing a degree in the College of Business and Social Sciences.
B. As an incoming freshman, recipient(s) must have a 3.0 minimum cumulative GPA in high school. A university student must have a 3.0 minimum cumulative GPA in college courses.
C. Scholarship is renewable if a 3.0 minimum GPA is maintained. The scholarship may be renewed up to a maximum of eight semesters for an incoming freshman only. All other classifications may receive the scholarship for the remaining semesters required to complete a four-year degree.
D. Needs based. Honoree’s intent is to assist students who have a financial need as evidenced by the Student Aid Report (SAR) received by the university after the FAFSA process is complete each year and who might otherwise be unable to attend college without this scholarship. Students who are eligible for federal educational grants which do not have to be repaid, such as Federal Pell Grants, are not eligible for this scholarship, absent very extenuating circumstances. The Admissions Office shall have the latitude to make such a decision keeping in mind the original intent of this donation.
The University of Louisiana Monroe Scholarship Office will award the scholarship based upon this governing criteria. more...

Dean's Honor Scholarship - Tulane University
The Dean's Honor Scholarship is open to full-time entering freshmen at Tulane University. You must rank in the top five percent of your class to be considered for this award. Selection is based on your class rank, academic program, honors and extracurricular activities. more...

Dean's Scholarship - Dillard University
The Dean's Scholarship is available to entering freshmen at Dillard University. You must have a minimum 3.0 GPA and at least a 21 ACT / 1060 SAT score to be eligible for this award. more...

Deans Honor Scholarships
Scholarship for incoming freshmen planning to attend Tulane University. Students who have a SAT score of 1450 or above or an ACT score of 33 or above, rank in the top 5% of their class, have taken honors and advanced placement courses, and participated in extracurricular activities are eligible to be considered. Submit teachers recommendation and a project with application packet. Award amount covers full tuition. Renewable; maintain 3.0 GPA. more...

Deans Scholarship For Academic Excellence
Scholarship for incoming, full-time freshmen enrolling at Loyola University New Orleans. Selection based on minimum cumulative high school GPA of 3.5, a minimum SAT score of 1300 or ACT score of 29, community involvement and leadership abilities. Award amounts are for variable partial tuition only. Number of awards may vary. Renewable. more...

Deborah Cofer First Generation Endowed Undergraduate Scholarship
The Deborah Cofer First Generation Endowed Undergraduate Scholarship was established through the ULM Foundation. The purpose is to increase college access and success for low-income first-generation students, enhance institutional efforts to provide need-based aid to undergraduate students and provide additional opportunities for benefactors to support the University of Louisiana at Monroe.
To qualify for the scholarship, a student must meet the following:
Recipient(s) must be a resident of Louisiana
Be a first-generation college student (your parents or guardians never earned a college degree) with financial need after the EFC (Estimated Family Contribution) and grants/scholarships are deducted or be a student, whether first-generation or not, who has been awarded the federal Pell grant and is admitted to the university during the semester(s) that the awards are disbursed.
Recipient(s) must meet university standards for acceptance at the University of Louisiana Monroe, must be admitted to the university, and must be pursuing their first undergraduate degree.
Scholarship may be renewed if a minimum 2.5 cumulative GPA is maintained. The scholarship may be renewed up to a maximum of seven semesters for an incoming freshman only.
All other classifications will receive the scholarship for the remaining semesters required to complete a four-year degree.
SELECTION OF RECIPIENT:
The University of Louisiana at Monroe TRiO Programs Office will select the recipient(s). The name of the recipient(s) shall be forwarded to the Scholarship Office as soon as a selection is made. more...

Waiver amounts are for undergraduate students only with respect to hours registered. Children who qualify will be limited to those who are eligible dependents for tax purposes during the calendar year that the fee exemption is issued. B. Recipient(s) must meet university standards for acceptance in the University of Louisiana at Monroe.
C. Scholarship is not renewable.
D. Special consideration shall be given for students who (1) are members of groups that are underrepresented at University of Louisiana Monroe, such as African Americans; or (2) have overcome obstacles such as socioeconomic or educational disadvantage; or (3) are the first generation in their family to attend college. Selection criteria may be modified or disregarded if determine in whole or in part to be contrary to law or then existing university policy.

2. The award will be based upon academic and clinical excellence with the recipient(s) maintaining a minimum overall GPA of 3.4.
3. The award will also be based upon the recipient(s) typifying the qualities of dedication and competence for which the nursing profession has been traditionally and rightly honored, including leadership; professionalism; clinical performance and quality of patient care; and caring and compassion for patients and their families. more...

Dr. David Irwin Graduate Student Research Scholarship
The scholarship shall be named the Dr. David Irwin Graduate Student Research Scholarship, established by family and friends in honor of Dr. David Irwin. The purpose is to provide scholarships for deserving graduate students in Speech-Language Pathology.
To qualify for the scholarship, a student must meet the following :
1. The recipient must be a full-time graduate student pursuing her/his graduate degree in the Speech-Language Pathology program.
2. Recipient(s) must meet university standards for acceptance in the University of Louisiana at Monroe. A university student must have a 3.25 graduate cumulative GPA in college courses and no grade of “C” or below in any graduate level Speech-Language Pathology courses.
3. Scholarship is not renewable.
4. Open to in-state and non-resident full-time students.
5. Applicants must submit a 500 word essay to Dr. Irwin regarding the importance of research to the field of Speech-Language Pathology more...

All other classifications may receive the scholarship for the remaining semesters required to complete a four year degree.
C. Donor’s intent is to assist students who have a financial need as evidenced by the Student Aid Report (SAR) received by the university after the FAFSA process is complete each year and who might otherwise be unable to attend college without this scholarship. Students who are eligible for federal educational grants that do not have to be repaid, such as Federal Pell Grants, are not eligible for this scholarship, absent very extenuating circumstances. Dr. Joshua L. Comer Superior Graduate Scholarship
To qualify for the scholarship, a student must meet the following:
A. Recipient must meet admittance requirements as defined by the ULM Graduate School and be enrolled full-time pursuing a Masters of Arts in Communication.
B. Recipient must have a minimum 3.5 GPA.
C. The scholarship is renewable for up to four semesters maximum.
D. Recipient must maintain a minimum GPA of 3.5 each semester to renew the scholarship.
E. Dr. Joshua L. Comer valued quality research and higher academic writing—therefore a competitive essay is appropriate. Applicants will write a 750—1,000 word letter-of-intent to include the following:
a. Introduction of who they are.
b. Academic goals, research, and career interests.
c. How the funds will be utilized.
IV. SELECTION OF RECIPIENT:
The ULM Scholarship Office will provide the eligible applicants to the Graduate School for ranking the candidates. The ranked list will be shared with the scholarship chairwoman, Dr. Cheyenne Comer, and her scholarship committee members to review for final ranking. Dr. Cheyenne Comer will submit her recommendations to the ULM Scholarship Office who will make the final scholarship awards. more...

Dr. Judy High Diffley & Dr. Gloria Brantley Endowed Business Scholarship
NAME AND PURPOSE:
The scholarship shall be named the Judy Diffley Business Award, established to provide assistance to students enrolled in the College of Business Administration.
CRITERIA FOR SELECTION:
To qualify for the scholarship, a recipient must meet the following:
A. The recipient(s) must be a full time student in the School of Business.
B. The recipient(s) must have a 3.0 GPA.
Business majors include Accounting, Computer Information Systems, Computer Science, Finance, Construction Management, Agribusiness, Aviation, Business Administration, Management, Marketing, Risk Management & Insurance. more...

2. Student must have a 28 composite ACT
3. Student must have a 3.5 high school GPA

Dr. Lucy Shackelford Memorial Scholarship
Established by friends and family in memory of Dr. Lucy Shackelford who loved teaching and gave so much of herself to the education profession.
1. Recipient(s) must be a full-time student majoring in Kinesiology (Teacher Certification) and have completed a minimum of 36 hours towards his/her degree.
2. Recipient(s) must meet each of the following requirements in order to renew the scholarship each semester: maintain 3.0 semester GPA, maintain 3.0 cumulative GPA, maintain 3.0 cumulative GPA in Kinesiology and complete at least 12 hours each semester.
3. The scholarship will be awarded for a maximum of two years (four semesters) or until a Bachelor’ s Degree in Kinesiology (Teacher Certification) is obtained, whatever period of time is shorter.
4. Recipient(s) must be enrolled during consecutive semesters.
5. Scholarships are not awarded during the summer.
6. Recipient(s) is expected to exemplify the best in good citizenship.
7. The scholarship can only be used for tuition and other related fees including books. No cash refund is allowed. more...

Dr. Robert Holt Award For Excellence In School Of Sciences
Established to honor the memory and contributions of Dr. Robert L. Holt who served as a faculty member of the Department of Chemistry from 1961-1992 and as department head 1981-1992. In addition, the award is to recognize and encourage achievement in the School of Sciences.
1. Recipient(s) must be a School of Sciences major and at least a sophomore or higher classification.
2. Recipient(s) must have a 2.5 minimum cumulative GPA and a 3.0 minimum GPA in School of Sciences courses.
3. Recipient(s) must have demonstrated outstanding performance in School of Sciences.
4. The scholarship is a one year award, but previous recipients may reapply and be considered with other applicants.
Eligible Majors: Atmospheric Science, Biology, Mathematics more...

Dufilho Legacy Scholarship
To qualify for the scholarship, a student must meet the following:
A. Recipient(s) must be a full-time student in pre-pharmacy, PharmD, or the PhD program in Pharmacy.
B. Recipient(s) must meet university standards for acceptance in the University of Louisiana at Monroe. A university student must have a 3.0 or higher cumulative GPA in all pharmacy courses or pre-pharmacy required courses if applying prior to beginning the professional program.
C. Recipient(s) must be a child, sibling, or an immediate family member of a Dufilho Society Member, ULM College of Pharmacy alumna or alumnus or ULM alumna or alumnus.
D. Recipient(s) must demonstrate history of a family legacy commitment to the ULM College of Pharmacy.
E. The scholarship may be renewed up to a maximum of seven semesters only for an incoming freshman who is enrolled in the pre-pharmacy program. All other classifications may receive the scholarship for the remaining semesters required to complete the PharmD program, or the PhD program in pharmacy.
F. Recipient(s) may only receive one scholarship from the Dufilho Society. more...

Dufilho Society Annual Scholarship
To qualify for the scholarship, a student must meet the following:
A. Recipient(s) must be a full-time student who has been admitted and accepted into the PharmD, or the PhD program in Pharmacy.
B. Recipient(s) must meet university standards for acceptance in the University of Louisiana Monroe. A university student must have a 3.0 or higher cumulative GPA in all pharmacy courses or pre-pharmacy required courses if applying prior to beginning the professional program.
C. Recipient(s) should be able to demonstrate leadership characteristics by providing proof of membership in at least one pharmacy organization and must provide service to the college. Recipient(s) will be required to attend events sponsored by the Dufilho Society.
D. This scholarships intent is to assist students who have a financial need as evidenced by the Student Aid Report (SAR) received by the university after the FAFSA process is complete each year and who might otherwise be unable to attend college without this scholarship. Students who are eligible for federal educational grants which do not have to be repaid, such as Federal Pell Grants, are not eligible for this scholarship, absent very extenuating circumstances. The Admissions Office shall have the latitude to make such a decision keeping in mind the original intent of this fund.
E. Recipient(s) may only receive one scholarship from the Dufilho Society.
F. Scholarship is non-renewable. more...

E.W. And Gladys Brown Memorial Scholarship
The E. W. and Gladys Brown Memorial Scholarship was established by Mr. Charles E. Brown of Monroe as a tribute to the memory of his parents.
1. Recipient(s) must be a person of integrity and high moral character.
2. Recipient(s) must possess a record of leadership ability.
3. Recipient(s) must be committed to attaining a college degree and making a career in a professional area such as Business, the Health Sciences or the Natural Sciences. The list, though not conclusive, should consist of majors in areas such as Business Management, Marketing, Accounting, Finance, Computer Science, Geosciences, Nursing, Occupational Therapy, Clinical Laboratory Science, Pre-Medicine, Pre-Dentistry, Construction and others. The essence of this requirement is that the skills attained should have a high marketability for the student upon graduation.
4. Recipient(s) must be an incoming freshman with an overall 3.0 GPA in high school. more...

Elise And Marcus Mapp Endowed Scholarship

2. As an incoming freshman, recipient(s) must have a 2.5 cumulative GPA in high school. A university student must have a minimum 2.5 cumulative GPA in college courses.
3. Scholarship is renewable if a minimum 2.5 GPA is maintained. The scholarship may be renewed up to a maximum of eight semesters for an incoming freshman only. All other classifications may receive the scholarship for the remaining semesters required to complete a four year undergraduate degree.

Emmett Foster Memorial Scholarship
Emmett Foster Memorial Scholarship was established in 1974 in memory of Emmett Foster, a professor in the College of Pure and Applied Sciences at Northeast Louisiana University.
1. Recipient(s) must be an incoming freshman who has maintained a high school GPA of 3.0 and scored 25 on the ACT.
2. Recipient(s) must be enrolled in the College of Arts, Education & Sciences.

Emmit Curry Memorial West Monroe Civitan Club Scholarship
Established by the West Monroe Civitan Club in memory of Emmit Curry.
1. Preference will be to an entering freshman, then to other classifications, including graduate level.
2. Recipient(s) must have an overall 2.5 GPA in high school. Recipient(s) must maintain a 2.5 GPA each semester to continue receiving the scholarship. (This scholarship is renewable for a maximum of 4 years or the number of semesters remaining to complete a four year degree.)
3. Preference is extended to students planning to pursue a degree and career in the Health Sciences, with additional consideration for those planning to work with the handicapped.
4. Preference is extended to students graduating from high schools in West Ouachita Parish.
5. Preference is extended to former Junior Civitan Club members.
6. Preference will be given to students who exhibit some financial need.
7. Recipient(s) must be a person of integrity and high moral character. more...

The scholarship shall be called the Employee Activity Committee Scholarship.

Ernest Duncan And Sophia Stockton Hollaway Scholarship
The Ernest Duncan and Sophia Stockton Holloway Scholarship was established by Ernest and Sophia Holloway and the purpose is to provide scholarships for deserving students.
To qualify for the scholarship, a student must meet the following:
A. Recipient(s) may be a full-time or part-time student pursuing their first undergraduate degree and must meet university standards for acceptance in the University of Louisiana at Monroe.
B. As an incoming freshman, recipient(s) must have a 3.0 cumulative GPA in high school.
C. Scholarship is renewable if a 3.0 GPA is maintained. The scholarship may be renewed up to a maximum of eight semesters for an incoming freshman only. All other classifications may receive the scholarship for the remaining semesters required to complete a four year degree. more...

Ernest Duncan And Sophia Stockton Holloway First Generation Endowed Undergraduate Scholarship
To qualify for the scholarship, a student must meet the following:
Recipient(s) must be a resident of Louisiana
Be a first-generation college student (your parents or guardians never earned a college degree) with financial need after the EFC (Estimated Family Contribution) and grants/scholarships are deducted or be a student, whether first-generation or not, who has been awarded the federal Pell grant and is admitted to the university during the semester(s) that the awards are disbursed.
Recipient(s) must meet university standards for acceptance at the University of Louisiana Monroe, must be admitted to the university, and must be pursuing their first undergraduate degree.
Scholarship may be renewed if a minimum 3.0 cumulative GPA is maintained. The scholarship may be renewed up to a maximum of seven semesters for an incoming freshman only.
All other classifications will receive the scholarship for the remaining semesters required to complete a four-year degree.
SELECTION OF RECIPIENT:
The University of Louisiana at Monroe TRiO Programs Office will select recipient(s). The name of recipient(s) shall be forwarded to the Scholarship Office as soon as selection is made. more...

Errold L. Seiler Major Impact Scholarship
To qualify for the scholarship, a student must meet the following:
A. The recipient may be a full-time or part-time student enrolled at ULM in one of the programs under the David and Sharon Turrentine School of Management.
B. Scholarship is renewable if the recipient maintains a minimum 3.0 GPA while under the scholarship award. The scholarship may be renewed up to a maximum of seven semesters for an incoming freshman only. All other classifications may receive the scholarship for the remaining semesters required to complete a four year degree.
C. Donor’s intent is to assist students who have a financial need as evidenced by the Student Aid Report (SAR) received by the university after the FAFSA process is complete each year and who might otherwise be unable to attend college without this scholarship. Students who are eligible for federal educational grants that do not have to be repaid, such as Federal Pell Grants, are not eligible for this scholarship, absent very extenuating circumstances. The Admissions Office shall have the latitude to make such a decision keeping in mind the original intent of this donation.
The University of Louisiana Monroe Scholarship Committee will make scholarship awards more...

Evelyn Mackay Scholarship
CRITERIA FOR SELECTION OF RECIPIENT:
1. Must be a junior or higher and major in health care related field. Preference will be given to a student working in the area of mental health and/or with handicapped individuals.
2. The recipient must have an overall GPA of 3.0 or better and must maintain at least a 3.0 each semester to renew the scholarship.
3. The recipient must exhibit integrity and high moral character.
4. Candidates must submit an application for scholarship in which the field of study is described and their expected area of employment.
5. Preference will be given to a resident of Northeast Louisiana in particular Richland and Caldwell parishes.

Applicants must have a minimum 3.0 GPA. Award amount is valued at full tuition. Application should be made directly to the clubs office in Houma. more...

Excel Scholarship - Southeastern Louisiana University
The ExCEL Scholarship is open to entering freshmen at Southeastern Louisiana University. You must be nominated by your principal or guidance counselor and demonstrate leadership, citizenship and community service to be eligible for this renewable award. more...

Scholarship for incoming freshmen students attending Southeastern Louisiana University. Applicant must demonstrate leadership, citizenship and community service. Candidates must be nominated by Principal or Guidance Counselor. Due date and number of awards varies. Renewable; 4 semesters. more...
