F.C. Haley Scholarship Fund
F.C. Haley donated the “F.C. Haley Scholarship Fund” to Louisiana Tech University.
Selection Criteria:
Student must be enrolling at Louisiana Tech University as a human ecology major.
Student must believe in the capitalistic free enterprise system and understand and appreciate the privileges and responsibilities of being an American citizen.
Student must have a high school GPA of at least 3.0 on a 4.0 system.
Student must be an outstanding high school senior as demonstrated by participating in leadership roles in school and community activities.
Student must maintain a 3.0 GPA each quarter as a full-time student. more...

Faculty Appreciation Scholarship In Economics
Annual award for undergraduate student attending Southeastern Louisiana University full-time, majoring in Business with emphasis in Economics. Applicant must have completed 12 credit hours of Economics curses at Southeastern and have a minimum 3.0 GPA. Due date and award amount varies. more...

Faculty Scholarship - Centenary College
The Faculty Scholarship is available to entering freshmen at Centenary College. You must have a minimum 3.4 GPA and a minimum 1100 SAT / 24 ACT score to be eligible for this award. more...

Faculty-Staff Fee Waiver Scholarship
Scholarship for faculty and staff members who plan to enroll in courses at Southeastern Louisiana University. Faculty/staff members must have completed two years of continuous full-time employment by the last day of regular registration for the semester in which enrollment is requested and are eligible for a fee waiver. Waiver amounts are awarded with respect to hours registered. Due date, number of awards and award amount varies. more...

Fae Adcock Stevenson Living Memorial Scholarship In Aviation
Edward E. Stevenson donated the “Fae Adcock Stevenson Living Memorial Scholarship in Aviation” to Louisiana Tech University to help further the education in students majoring in Professional Aviation.
Selection Criteria:
The scholarship recipient(s) must be registered and remain registered as a full-time student for the quarter in which he/she receives the scholarship at Louisiana Tech University.
Scholarship(s) shall be awarded to a student majoring in Professional Aviation.
The scholarship recipient must maintain a 2.5 GPA in all official college courses.
Recipient must be a sophomore, junior, or senior at the time of receiving the scholarship. more...

Selection Criteria:
The scholarship recipient must be registered and remain registered as a full-time student for the quarter in which he/she receives the scholarship at Louisiana Tech University.
Student must be majoring in an engineering curriculum.
Student must maintain a 2.5 GPA in all official college courses. more...

Family & Consumer Sciences Scholarship For Excellence
Annual award for an undergraduate junior or senior attending Nicholls State University full-time, majoring in General Family and Consumer Sciences with a concentration in Child, Family and Social Services, Vocational Family and Consumer Sciences Education or Birth to Five/Early Interventionist Education. Applicant must have completed 60 credit hours with a 3.0 GPA or above, have financial need, service activities and professional participation. Student should be a member of NAFCS. Award amount is paid in equal amounts for fall and spring semesters. more...

Farmers Grain Terminal Scholarship
*Established in the year 2000 to benefit students from the service areas of Farmers Grain Terminal, Inc.
1. Recipient(s) must be an incoming freshman with a 3.0 GPA.
2. Recipient(s) must be a high school graduate from one of the following parishes: East Carroll, West Carroll, Richland, Madison, Franklin, Tensas, Catahoula or Concordia parishes in Louisiana; Bolivar, Washington, Sunflower, Leflore, Humphreys, Holmes, Yazoo, Sharkey or lssaquena counties in Mississippi; Drew, Desha, Ashley or Chicot counties in Arkansas.
3. Scholarship is not renewable. more...

Femmes Natales Club Of Thibodaux Scholarship
Annual award for resident of Lafourche Parish, Louisiana who is an undergraduate junior or senior attending Nicholls State University full-time. Applicant must be a graduate of a Thibodaux high school. Candidate must have a minimum 2.5 GPA and cannot be receiving any other financial award. Award amount varies. Student must maintain a 2.5 GPA. more...

Ferdinand Dominguez & Isabella Depetirate Dominguez Memorial Scholarship
Scholarship for undergraduate students attending Loyola University New Orleans who are majoring in Education. Selection based academic achievement, financial need, community involvement and leadership abilities. Due date, number of awards, and award amount may vary. more...

Fifth District Pharmaceutical Association Scholarship
The Fifth District Pharmaceutical Association Scholarship was established by the Association to be awarded to deserving pharmacy students.
1. Recipient(s) must be a professional pharmacy student in the first, second, or third year of the professional program.
2. Recipient(s) must have a 3.2 GPA in the professional program to receive the scholarship.
3. Recipient(s) must be a resident of one of the parishes in Louisiana Fifth Pharmacy District. District Five is comprised of the parishes of Caldwell, East Carroll, Franklin, Jackson, Lincoln, Madison, Morehouse, Ouachita, Richland, Tensas, Union, West Carroll, and Winn.
4. Additional criteria which may be used for selection include: Financial status, Involvement in professional activities, and Involvement in community
5. The scholarship is non-renewable. Prior recipients of this scholarship are ineligible for future awards. more...

Firefighters Disability Exemption Scholarship
Scholarship for dependents of any firefighter injured in duty who are undergraduate students attending Nicholls State University full-time. Firefighters injuries must have resulted in an inability for the parent to continue to be employed. Number of awards and award amount varies. Renewable; maintain 2.0 GPA. more...

First American Bank Scholarship
Scholarship for residents of Assumption, Jefferson, Lafourche, St. Charles, and St. James Parishes in Louisiana who are undergraduate students attending Nicholls State University. Applicants must be from low to moderate family incomes and have financial need. One recipient will be selected from each of the previously mentioned parishes. Award amount varies and is valid for one semester; recipient must maintain 2.5 GPA. more...

First Generation Endowed Undergraduate Scholarship
The First Generation Endowed Undergraduate Scholarship was established through the ULM Foundation. The purpose is to increase college access and success for low-income first-generation students, enhance institutional efforts to provide need-based aid to undergraduate students and provide additional opportunities for benefactors to support the University of Louisiana at Monroe.
To qualify for the scholarship, a student must meet the following:
Recipient(s) must be a resident of Louisiana
Be a first-generation college student (your parents or guardians never earned a college degree) with financial need after the EFC (Estimated Family Contribution) and grants/scholarships are deducted or be a student, whether first-generation or not, who has been awarded the federal Pell grant and is admitted to the university during the semester(s) that the awards are disbursed.
Recipient(s) must meet university standards for acceptance at the University of Louisiana Monroe, must be admitted to the university, and must be pursuing their first undergraduate degree.
Scholarship may be renewed if a minimum 2.5 cumulative GPA is maintained. The scholarship may be renewed up to a maximum of seven semesters for an incoming freshman only.
All other classifications will receive the scholarship for the remaining semesters required to complete a four-year degree.
SELECTION OF RECIPIENT:
The University of Louisiana at Monroe TRiO Programs Office will select the recipient(s). The name of the recipient(s) shall be forwarded to the Scholarship Office as soon as a selection is made. more...

First Guaranty Bank Assistantship Scholarship
Scholarship for residents of Tangipahoa Parish, Louisiana who are undergraduate students attending Southeastern Louisiana University, majoring in Business. Applicants must have a minimum 3.25 GPA. Selection based on students qualifications and availability to work when needed. Due date, number of awards and award amount varies. more...

First Guaranty Bank Nursing Scholarship
Annual award for undergraduate junior or senior attending Southeastern Louisiana University full-time, majoring in Nursing. Preference given to Tangipahoa Parish residents. Applicant must have financial need. Students must apply by writing a letter to the Dean of the School of Nursing requesting they be considered for a scholarship. Due date and award amount varies. more...

Florence Zeigler Allbritton Piano Award

Florine A. Petit Education Scholarship
Annual award for resident of the Tenth Ward of Lafourche Parish, Louisiana who is an undergraduate junior or senior student attending Nicholls State University full-time, majoring in Education. Applicant must have financial need, and a minimum 2.5 GPA. Renewable; maintain 2.5 GPA. more...

Floy Antley Wilhite Memorial Scholarship
Established in memory of Mrs. Wilhite, who dedicated her life to the teaching profession. Mrs. Wilhite was in the first graduating class (1933) of Ouachita Jr. College. She was a teacher for 33 years prior to her retirement in 1970. She taught at Wilhite School from 1933-1938, Point School in Union Parish from 1938-1942, Drew School 1945-1946, and Millsaps School from 1947-1970.
1. Recipient(s) must be a Louisiana resident.
2. Recipient(s) must be an Education major and have a commitment to pursuing a career in teaching.
3. Recipient(s) must have completed at least 30 hours of courses and have a 3.0 GPA.
4. The scholarship is renewable for up to 3 years if the recipient maintains a 3.0 GPA and remains a full time student. more...

Forbes Leadership Award Endowment Scholarship
Selection Criteria:
Recipient must be majoring in an Agricultural Sciences program.
Recipient must have a minimum GPA of 3.0. more...

Francis Pryor Baldwin Memorial Endowed Scholarship
Established by family and friends in memory of Frances Pryor Baldwin. The purpose of the award shall be to honor the memory and contributions of Frances Pryor Baldwin. In addition, the award is to encourage achievement in the field of School of Sciences.
1. Recipient(s) must be School of Sciences major and at least a junior or higher classification.
2. Recipient(s) must have a 2.5 minimum cumulative gradepoint average and a 3.0 minimum gradepoint average in courses in the School of Sciences.
3. Recipient(s) must have demonstrated outstanding performance in School of Sciences.
4. The scholarship is a one year award, but previous recipients may reapply and be considered with other applicants.
Eligible Majors: Atmospheric Science, Biology, Mathematics more...

Francis Wadsworth Science Fund Scholarship
The scholarship shall be named the Francis Wadsworth Science Fund, established originally as the Francis T. and Marion S. Wadsworth Endowment by family and friends in honor and in memory of Dr. Wadsworth. During his lifetime, Dr. Wadsworth donated much of his time and expertise in support of education. Dr. Wadsworth had a great deal to contribute and his quiet manner shared his abilities freely with the community. The purpose is to provide scholarships for deserving science majors.
To qualify for the scholarship, a student must meet the following:
1. Recipient(s) may be a full-time or part-time student pursuing a degree in Biology, Atmospheric Science or Pre-Pharmacy.
2. Recipient(s) must meet university standards for acceptance in the University of Louisiana at Monroe. As an incoming freshman, recipient(s) must have a 2.5 cumulative GPA in high school. A university student must have a 2.5 cumulative GPA in college courses.
3. Scholarship is renewable if a 2.5 GPA is maintained. The scholarship may be renewed up to a maximum of eight semesters for an incoming freshman only. All other classifications may receive the scholarship for the remaining semesters required to complete a four year degree.
SELECTION OF RECIPIENT: The College of Arts & Sciences Scholarship Committee will send recommended recipient(s) name(s) to the University of Louisiana at Monroe Scholarship Committee for final selection(s). The name of recipient(s) shall be forwarded to the Scholarship Office as soon as selection is made. more...

Established by the Franciscan Missionaries of Our Lady Sisters to provide nursing scholarships.
1. Recipient(s) must be a nursing student in the junior or senior year of the ULM Nursing Program and must have completed Semester II.
2. Recipient(s) must have a cumulative 2.7 GPA to be selected.
3. Recipient(s) must live in the service area of St. Francis Medical Center. more...

Frank A. Micelli Memorial Scholarship
Scholarship for graduate of any high school in Tangipahoa Parish who is an incoming freshman accepted at Southeastern Louisiana University full-time, majoring in Mathematics or an appropriate allied study. Applicants must have a 3.0 high school GPA, must be of good moral character and an achiever in extracurricular activities. Due date and award amount varies. Renewable. more...

Frank And Susan Hoffmann Superior Graduate Scholarship
To qualify for the scholarship, a student must meet the following:
A. Recipient(s) may be a full-time or part-time student.
B. The scholarship award amount will be evenly divided between deserving recipient(s) within the School of Education and the College of Business and Social Sciences.
C. Recipient(s) meet ULM admission requirements as defined by their respective programs.
D. Recipient(s) must be a citizen of the United States.
E. Recipient(s) must be from the state of Louisiana with preference from Ouachita Parish.
F. Recipient(s) must meet the minimum 3.0 GPA requirements for each respective program.
G. Recipient(s) must maintain minimum 3.0 GPA requirements for each respective program to remain eligible for the scholarship.
The ULM Scholarship Office will provide the names of all applicants who meet the criteria listed above to the Scholarship Committees of the School of Education and the College of Business and Social Sciences. The Scholarship Committees will submit recommendations to the University Scholarship Office who will confirm eligibility and determine awards. more...

Gayle & Merrick Jones Endowed Scholarship In Music

Gene W. And Vivian Jircik Muckleroy Endowed Scholarship
To qualify for the scholarship, a recipient must meet the following:
A. Preference will be given to residents of the Louisiana Baptist Children’s Home and / or a US Veteran and/or children of US veterans.
B. Recipient(s) may be a full-time or part-time student pursuing a degree and / or gaining experience through an internship.
C. As an incoming freshman, recipient(s) must have a 2.5 minimum cumulative GPA in high school. A university student must have a 2.5 minimum cumulative GPA in college courses.
D. Scholarship is renewable if a 2.5 minimum GPA is maintained. The scholarship may be renewed up to a maximum of eight semesters for an incoming freshman only. All other classifications may receive the scholarship for the remaining semesters required to complete a four-year degree.
E. Needs based. Donor’s intent is to assist students who have a financial need as evidenced by the Student Aid Report (SAR) received by the university after the FAFSA process is complete each year and who might otherwise be unable to attend college without this scholarship. Students who are eligible for federal educational grants which do not have to be repaid, such as Federal Pell Grants, are not eligible for this scholarship, absent very extenuating circumstances. The Admissions Office shall have the latitude to make such a decision keeping in mind the original intent of this donation.
The University of Louisiana Monroe Scholarship Office will award the scholarship based upon these governing criteria. more...

Students will be given preference in the selection process if they: a) do not live with parents and, therefore, have higher living costs b) have greater financial need than others being considered c) have classifications in the following preferred order: seniors, juniors, graduate student, sophomores, freshman. more...

George Moses Memorial Endowed Scholarship
Established by the Downtown Monroe Lions Club to honor the memory of fellow Lion George Moses, who exhibited the meaning of Lionism. Mr. Moses was the first businessman to make a donation to the NLU Foundation in 1961.
A. Recipient(s) must have successfully completed thirty (30) or more semester hours of collegiate credits with a minimum overall grade point average (GPA) prior to the semester for which the award is made of 3.4 as an undergraduate or 3.2 as a graduate student;
B. Recipient(s) must be enrolled full-time as a major in a curriculum which leads to a degree as a Speech, Language, Hearing Specialist;
C. Recipient(s) must remain a full-time student in good standing with the University and GPA in order for the scholarship to remain in force for the second term of award. The scholarship is not-renewable. more...

The purpose of the “George Roy Hayes, Jr. Endowed Scholarships” is to attract and retain outstanding undergraduate and graduate students in the School of Biological Sciences.
Selection Criteria:
Student must be a Biology major.
Student must have completed a minimum of 30 credit hours at Louisiana Tech by time the application is submitted.
Student must have a minimum Cumulative and Course GPA of 3.5. more...

The purpose of the “George Roy Hayes, Jr. Endowed Scholarships” is to attract and retain outstanding undergraduate and graduate students in the School of Biological Sciences.
Selection Criteria:
Student must be a Biology major.
Student must have a minimum Cumulative and Course GPA of 3.5. more...

George Welch Endowment Education Scholarship
Established by the family of George W. Welch, who dedicated his life to education as a teacher, principal and Ouachita Parish School Superintendent (1943-1948).
1. Recipient(s) must be a young man of integrity, high moral character and outstanding leadership qualities.
2. Recipient(s) must be pursuing a degree in Education.
3. Recipient(s) must be a Louisiana resident, preferably from Ouachita Parish.
4. Recipient(s) must have a 3.0 GPA in high school.
5. The scholarship shall be renewable for four years if a 3.0 GPA is maintained. more...

Gerald & Anne Arrant Scholarship In Insurance
The Gerald & Anne Arrant Scholarship in Insurance was established by Gerald and Anne Arrant.
1. Recipient(s) may be of any classification.
2. Recipient(s) must have been a resident of Louisiana during his/her high school years.
3. Recipient(s) must have attained a 3.0 GPA in high school and must have a score of 21 or higher on the ACT Test.
4. Recipient(s) must be pursuing a degree in Business with an express interest in going into the general insurance business.
5. Recipient(s) must maintain a 2.75 cum GPA and remain a student in good standing with the University during the four years of the scholarship. more...

Applicants must have a minimum 3.0 GPA. Consideration given for financial need, personality, character, purpose and leadership. Should no applicant meet the residency requirement, applicants from Lafourche or St. Mary parishes will be considered. Award amount varies. more...

Gertie & Eldrice Green Endowment Scholarship
Established in 1994 from the bequest of Mrs. Gertie Mae Allen Green who died in October 1994, and Mr. Eldrice H. Green. Mrs. Green had a lifelong dedication to education having taught in Union Parish for many years as well as helping others pursue advanced degrees. The purpose is to provide scholarships for deserving students majoring in education.
1. Recipient(s) must be enrolled in the School Education as a full time student or in a full time equivalency program (i.e. student teaching).
2. As an incoming freshman, recipient(s) must have a 2.0 cumulative GPA. A university student must have a 2.0 cumulative GPA in college courses.
3. Scholarship is renewable if a 2.0 average is maintained. The scholarship may be renewed up to a maximum of eight semesters for an incoming freshman only. All other classifications will receive the scholarship for the remaining semesters required to complete a four year degree. more...

Glenda Gates Otten Endowed Scholarship For Medical Laboratory Science
NAME AND PURPOSE:
The scholarship shall be named the Glenda Gates Otten Endowed Scholarship for Medical Laboratory Science, and is being established by Doug and Glenda Otten in honor of Glendaâ€™s Medical Technology degree obtained in 1967 and her professional career. The purpose of this endowment is to provide scholarship funding for deserving students in the professional Medical Laboratory Science Program.
CRITERIA FOR SELECTION:
To qualify for the endowment, a student must meet the following:
A. Recipient(s) must be a full-time student in the professional Medical Laboratory Science Program.
B. Recipient(s) must meet university standards for continuation at the University of Louisiana at Monroe and in the professional Medical Laboratory Science Program.
C. Recipient(s) must have a cumulative 3.0 or higher GPA and must maintain a cumulative 3.0 or higher GPA for renewal of the scholarship.
SELECTION OF RECIPIENT:
The Medical Laboratory Science Scholarship Committee will send recommended recipient(s) name(s) to the University of Louisiana at Monroe Scholarship Committee for final selection(s). The name of recipient(s) shall be forwarded to the Scholarship Office as soon as selection is made. more...

Grant Adair Gorman Memorial Endowed Scholarship For Nursing
Stanley M. Gorman donated the “Grant Adair Gorman Memorial Endowed Scholarship” to Louisiana Tech University.
Selection Criteria:
Student must be registered and remain registered as a full-time student for the quarter in which he/she receives the scholarship at Louisiana Tech University.
Student must maintain a minimum 2.5 GPA in all official college courses.
Student must be majoring in electrical engineering or nursing. The scholarship will be alternated between these two curricula, with the scholarship being awarded in electrical engineering in academic years beginning with an even number (e.g. 2002-2003) and awarded in nursing in academic years beginning with an odd number (e.g. 2003-2004). more...

The recipient of this award shall maintain an overall 2.0 GPA on all official college course work.
The award shall be presented to a student considered to have exceptional talent in Performing Arts.
The scholarship recipient(s) must be registered and remain registered as a full-time student for the quarter in which he/she receives the scholarship at Louisiana Tech University.
The award is intended to assist recipients in attending conferences, master classes, tours or other professional activities.
The award is not to be presented on the basis of financial need.
Jorenda Stone, “ So it’s not important to me that the money not be used in a traditional way but rather in an exhilarating way for the student.” more...

4. The award shall be for one year.

Harold Turner Endowed Superior Graduate Student Scholarship
To qualify for the scholarship, a student must meet the following:
A. Recipient must be a new, thesis-based Biology M.S. applicant.
B. Recipient must have a 3.5 undergraduate GPA.
C. Recipient must meet ULM GRE requirements as defined by the Graduate School.
â€¢ Minimum Graduate Record Examination (verbal + quantitative) converted score of 750
â€¢ Minimum formula score of 1875 (GPA*GRE)
D. Recipient must be enrolled as a full time student.
E. The scholarship award will cover a two-academic-year period (continuous, four semesters) and will be non-renewable. Graduate students who do not complete their M.S. degrees in the two-year period will be eligible for a Teaching Assistantship in the third year of study.
F. Recipient must maintain a GPA of 3.25 each semester and significant progress in research. more...

Harper Family Foundation Scholarship
The Harper Family Foundation Scholarship was established by the Harper Family Foundation in honor of James Ansel Harper, a longtime successful businessman in Crowville, Franklin Parish, Louisiana. The Harper Family Foundation was established for charitable, educational, literary and scientific purposes. Therefore, the establishment of the Harper Family Foundation Scholarship for students from Franklin Parish is exemplary of their support of education.
To qualify for the scholarship, a student must meet the following:
1. Recipient(s) must be a full-time incoming freshman student pursuing their first undergraduate degree.
2. Scholarship is not renewable. Each award shall be a one-time award to an incoming freshman.
3. Recipient(s) must be a graduate of a public or private high school in Franklin Parish. more...

C. As an incoming freshman, recipient(s) must have a 2.5 cumulative GPA in high school. A university student must have a 2.5 cumulative GPA in college courses.

Hilburn Memorial Endowed Scholarship
Donald R. Hilburn established the “Hilburn Memorial Endowed Scholarship” at Louisiana Tech University.
Selection Criteria:
Recipient must be majoring in a curriculum within the College of Engineering and Science.
Recipient must be a graduate of a school in Webster Parish.
Recipient must have a minimum high school GPA of 3.0.
Recipient must have a minimum ACT score of 25.
Recipient must be in the top 10% or top 5% of their high school graduating class.
Recipient must be a legal resident of the State of Louisiana.
Recipient, if already enrolled at Tech, must have a minimum GPA of 2.5 for their first quarter, a minimum GPA of 3.0 for subsequent quarters, and a minimum overall GPA of 3.0.
The recipient must be registered and remain registered as a full-time student for the quarter in which he/she receives the scholarship at Louisiana Tech University.
1st preference to a student who graduated from Cotton Valley High School.
2nd preference to a student who graduated from Webster Parish High School. more...

Hill's Pet Nutrition Service Scholarship
The Hill's Pet Nutrition Service Scholarship is available to students at the Louisiana State University School of Veterinary Medicine. You must be a first-, second- or third-year student and demonstrate leadership, character and contributions to the School of Veterinary Medicine to be eligible for this award. more...

Hill-Krause Business Endowed Scholarship
Annual award for undergraduate student attending Southeastern Louisiana University, majoring in Business. Applicant must have financial need and evidence of academic excellence. Due date and award amount varies. Renewable. more...

Hollis Graham Endowment Scholarship In Construction
The Hollis Graham Memorial Scholarship was established by family, friends, and Northeast Louisiana Contractors, A.G.C., in memory of Hollis Graham who was an outstanding Lincoln Parish businessman who had a deep concern for the importance of education.
1. Recipient(s) must be majoring in Construction.
2. Recipient(s) must have at least a 2.5 GPA.
3. To renew the scholarship, the recipient(s) must earn at least a 2.5 GPA. more...

Holly & Smith, Architects, Inc. Excellence In Visual Arts & Music Scholarship
Scholarship for graduating high school seniors from Tangipahoa, St. Tammany and West Feliciana Parishes who have been accepted at Southeastern Louisiana University, majoring in Visual Arts or Music. Applicants must have a minimum 3.0 GPA. Any recipient who majors in visual arts must leave a piece of his/her art at Southeastern Louisiana and any recipient who majors in music must perform a concert during his/her senior year. Due date, number of awards and award amount varies. Renewable; must maintain a 2.75 GPA. more...

Home Builders Association Of Northeast Louisiana Scholarship
The Northeast Louisiana Home Builders Association, Inc. Scholarship Endowment was established in 1988. In 2006, the name changed to the Home Builders Association of Northeast Louisiana Scholarship.
1. Recipient(s) must be a full-time student pursuing their first undergraduate degree in Construction.
2. Recipient(s) must be a sophomore or junior at the time of application.
3. Recipient(s) must have a 2.5 cumulative GPA in college courses.
4. Scholarship is renewable if a 3.0 GPA in Construction courses is maintained. The scholarship may be renewed for the remaining semesters required to complete a four year degree.
5. Recipient(s) must be a high school graduate or equivalent. more...

Home Economics Endowed Scholarship
This scholarship is intended for students in the College of Applied and Natural Sciences.
Selection Criteria:
Recipient must be majoring in Human Ecology.
Recipient may be any class level including Graduate Student. more...

Honeywell Scholarship
Scholarship for incoming freshmen enrolled full-time at the University of Louisiana-Lafayette Computer Science Department. Students must have a minimum 25 ACT score. Consideration given to minority students. Due date and number of awards may vary. Renewable. more...

Hood Automotive Endowed Scholarship In Business
Annual award for undergraduate student attending Southeastern Louisiana University full-time, majoring in Business. Beginning freshmen must have a cumulative high school GPA of 3.0 or higher. Continuing students must have a cumulative GPA of 3.0 or higher on all coursework completed. Due date and award amount varies. Renewable for 8 semesters; maintain 3.0 GPA. more...

Horace & Rosamond M. Austin, Sr. Memorial Scholarship
Scholarship for undergraduate students enrolled full-time at McNeese State University majoring in Nursing. Deadlines and award amounts may vary. more...

Houma Chapter Of The American Petroleum Institution Scholarship
Annual award for a resident of Terrebonne or Lafourche Parish, Louisiana who is an undergraduate sophomore student attending Nicholls State University full-time. Applicant must have graduated from a high school in Terrebonne or Lafourche Parish and cannot hold any other financial award, unless approved by the Board of Directors of the Houma Chapter. Selection based on financial need, personality, purpose and leadership. Preference given to students majoring in Engineering Technology. Renewable; maintain 2.5 GPA. more...

Houma Courier Journalism Scholarship
Annual award for a graduating high school senior from a public or parochial high school in Terrebonne Parish, Louisiana who has been accepted to Nicholls State University full-time, majoring in Print Journalism or Advertising. more...

Houma Lions Club Scholarship
Scholarship for incoming freshmen students accepted to attending Nicholls State University full-time. more...

Houma Rotary Club, Doug Stire Memorial Scholarship
Annual award for a resident of Terrebonne or Lafourche Parish who graduated from Terrebonne Parish High School and is an undergraduate junior or senior attending Nicholls State University full-time. Award amount varies. more...

Howard E. Blackstock Memorial Scholarship
Selection of recipients will be based on the following:
A. Must be a full-time student with at least a 2.0 GPA in high school or college
B. Must demonstrate financial need
C. Must be employed in a part-time job
D. Must maintain a 2.0 average to renew the scholarship
E. Must be major in the area of Business
Selection of the recipient will be made by the ULM Scholarship Committee more...

Howard E. Blackstock Memorial Scholarship
The Howard E. Blackstock Memorial Scholarship was established from the bequest of Florene Blackstock in memory of her husband, Howard, who passed away in 1976.
1. Recipient(s) must be a full-time student with at least a 2.0 GPA in high school or college.
2. Recipient(s) must be employed in a part-time job.
3. Recipient(s) must maintain a 2.0 GPA to renew the scholarship.
4. Recipient(s) must be a pursuing a degree in the College of Business & Social Sciences. more...

Howard Hicks Memorial Endowed Scholarship
To qualify for the scholarship, a student must meet the following:
A. The recipient(s) must be a Union Parish student, who is enrolled or planning to enroll as a full-time freshman at ULM.
B. As an incoming freshman, recipient(s) must have a 3.0 cumulative GPA in high school.
C. Scholarship is not renewable.
The Union Parish Alumni Chapter will send recommended recipient(s) name(s) to the University of Louisiana at Monroe Scholarship Committee for final selection(s). The name of recipient(s) shall be forwarded to the Scholarship Office as soon as selection is made.
(The Union Parish Alumni Chapter is currently dormant so awards will be made by the Scholarship Office until the chapter is restarted by the ULM Alumni Association) more...

Howard's Endowed Scholarship
To qualify for the scholarship, a student must meet the following:
A. Recipient(s) may be a full-time or part-time student pursuing their first undergraduate degree.
B. Donor intent is to assist students who have a financial need as evidenced by the Student Aid Report (SAR) received by the university after the FAFSA process is complete each year and who might otherwise be unable to attend college without this scholarship. Students who are eligible for federal educational grants which do not have to be repaid, such as Federal Pell Grants, are not eligible for this scholarship, absent very extenuating circumstances. The Admissions Office shall have the latitude to make such a decision keeping in mind the original intent of this donation.
C. As an incoming freshman, recipient(s) must have a 3.0 cumulative GPA in high school. A university student must have a 2.75 cumulative GPA in college courses.
D. Recipient(s) must have a score of 24 on the ACT or its equivalent.
E. Scholarship is renewable if a 2.75 GPA is maintained. The scholarship may be renewed up to a maximum of seven semesters for an incoming freshman only. All other classifications will receive the scholarship for the remaining semesters required to complete a four year degree. more...

Huble Leader Memorial Scholarship
Annual award for graduating high school senior from Maurepas High School in Maurepas, Louisiana who is an undergraduate student attending Southeastern Louisiana University full-time. Applicant must have a minimum 3.0 GPA, have leadership qualities and participate in varsity athletics. Due date varies. Renewable; maintain 2.5 GPA. more...

Humanities & Social Sciences Tiger Athletic Foundation Scholarship
The Humanities & Social Sciences Tiger Athletic Foundation Scholarship is available to students at Louisiana State University. You must be enrolled in the College of Humanities & Social Sciences, demonstrate financial need, and have a minimum 3.4 GPA to be eligible for this award. more...

Hurley School Of Music Scholarships
Scholarship for undergraduate students admitted to attend Centenary College of Louisiana full-time, studying Music. Awards are offered for both majors and non-majors who participate in one of the Universitys ensembles. Audition dates are February 3 & 4 and March 10 & 11th; student may be able to arrange private auditions as well. Number of awards and award amount varies. more...

Ignatian Scholarship For Academic Excellence
Scholarship for incoming, full-time freshmen enrolling at Loyola University New Orleans. Selection based on minimum cumulative high school GPA of 3.5, a minimum SAT score of 1300 or ACT score of 29, an interview, community involvement and leadership abilities. Award amounts are for variable partial tuition only. Number of awards may vary. Renewable. more...

Independence Lions Club Scholarship
Scholarship for incoming freshman attending Southeastern Louisiana University full-time. Applicant must have a minimum 2.0 GPA and be involved in the community. Due date varies. more...

Ingree Cooper Peterson Memorial Scholarship
Annual award for a second-semester undergraduate freshman attending Nicholls State University full-time. Applicant must have the highest grade point average. Award amount varies. more...

Ingrid Lily Frolich Burns Scholarship
Scholarship for undergraduate students attending Loyola University New Orleans who are majoring in Ministry. Selection based academic achievement, community involvement and leadership abilities. Due date, number of awards, and award amount may vary. more...

Institute Of Managerial Accountants (Ima) Scholarship
Annual award for undergraduate student attending Southeastern Louisiana University, majoring in Accounting. Applicant must have an interest in a career in Managerial Accounting, one semester remaining before graduation (excluding summer semester), and be an active student member of Southeasterns chapter of IMA. Due date and award amount varies. more...

Insurance Professionals Of Shreveport/Bossier Endowed Scholarship
1. Student should be at least a 2nd year student
2. Student must have at least a 20 composite score on the ACT
3. Student must have minimum 2.5 GPA on any university work completed prior to receiving the award
4. Student must be enrolled in the LSUS School of Business
5. Student must be pursuing one of the following majors: Accounting, Economics, Finance, General Business, Management, or Marketing
6. Must be interested in pursuing a career in Insurance more...

Ira S. Tate Scholarship
Annual award for resident of Baton Rouge, Louisiana who is an undergraduate student attending Southeastern Louisiana University full-time. Preference given to students with focused career plan, particularly in the helping professions such as teaching, nursing, etc.. Applicant must be an adoptive child abandoned by his/her adoptive parents. Due date varies. more...

Ira S. Tate Scholarship
The Ira S. Tate Scholarship is available to students at Southeastern Louisiana University. You must be a Baton Rouge resident. You must also be an adoptive child who was abandoned by your adoptive parents to be eligible for this award. more...

3. Student must have a 2.5 GPA

5. Student must be pursuing his/her first undergraduate degree more...

J. Hilton Heard Endowment Scholarship In Construction
The J. Hilton Heard Memorial Scholarship established by the Northeast Louisiana Contractors Association, A.G.C., in memory of J. Hilton Heard, a prominent Northeast Louisiana construction contractor, and the purpose is to provide scholarships for deserving students.
1. Recipient(s) may be a full-time student pursuing their first undergraduate degree in Construction.
2. As an incoming freshman, recipient(s) must have a 2.5 cumulative GPA in high school. A university student must have a 2.5 cumulative GPA in college courses.
3. Scholarship is renewable if a 2.5 average is maintained. The scholarship may be renewed up to a maximum of seven semesters for an incoming freshman only. All other classifications may receive the scholarship for the remaining semesters required to complete a four year degree. more...

J. P. Morgan Chase Endowed Scholarship In The College Of Sciences
1. Student must be in a graduate level computer science related program to benefit the needs of the Cyber Innovation Center more...

J. Quitman Long Family Endowment
Louisiana Tech made a huge impact on Jared Quitman Long’s life by allowing him to secure a degree when he financially could not afford to do so. To make a contribution to the University, Jared Long and Loutie Taylor Long started the “J. Quitman Long Family Endowment”.
Recipient must be an Incoming Freshman.
Recipient must have a minimum 2.5 High School GPA.
Recipient must not have an ACT composite score of more than 22.
The scholarship will be presented to either a student from the Colfax area, Spearsville High School, Union High School, Mansfield High School, or University High School (Baton Rouge, LA). more...

J. Wayne Medley Endowment Memorial Scholarship
The J. Wayne Medley Endowed Memorial Scholarship was established as a memorial to honor J. Wayne Medley by his family, friends and colleagues.
1. Recipient(s) may be full or part-time students, majoring in the accredited business program areas within the College of Business & Social Sciences, with preference given to those majoring in General Business, Economics, Entrepreneurship, or Finance.
2. Recipient(s) shall have completed a minimum of 60 credit hours, must be in good standing with the University, and must remain in good standing to qualify for renewal of the scholarship up to a maximum of four (4) semesters and two (2) summer sessions.
3. Preference will be given to residents of Ouachita Parish.
4. Preference will be given to applicants whose family members are either realtors or certified appraisers, or applicants referred by the Northeast Louisiana Board of Realtors or the Society of Real Estate Appraisers. more...

The scholarship recipient must be a Chemical Engineering student at Louisiana Tech University.
The scholarship recipient(s) must be registered and remain registered as a full-time student for the quarter in which he/she receives the scholarship at Louisiana Tech University.
The student must have a minimum 2.5 GPA. more...

Student must be majoring in Civil Engineering.
Students must have a minimum 2.5 GPA. more...

Jack And Ann Hayes Memorial Scholarship
The Ann & Jack Hayes Memorial Scholarship was established by former students of Ouachita Parish High School to honor Ann & Jack Hayes who served as librarian and principal for 41 years.
1. Recipient(s) must be a graduating senior from one of the high schools in Ouachita Parish.
2. Recipient(s) must be pursuing a degree in Education.
3. Recipient(s) must have an ACT score of 22 and a 3.0 GPA in high school.
4. The scholarship is for one year and is not renewable. more...

Applicants must have a minimum 3.0 GPA in Chemistry Courses (CHEM 121,122,123,124). James Cofer First Generation Endowed Undergraduate Scholarship
To qualify for the scholarship, a student must meet the following:
Recipient(s) must be a resident of Louisiana
Be a first-generation college student (your parents or guardians never earned a college degree) with financial need after the EFC (Estimated Family Contribution) and grants/scholarships are deducted or be a student, whether first-generation or not, who has been awarded the federal Pell grant and is admitted to the university during the semester(s) that the awards are disbursed.
Recipient(s) must meet university standards for acceptance at the University of Louisiana Monroe, must be admitted to the university, and must be pursuing their first undergraduate degree.
Scholarship may be renewed if a minimum 2.5 cumulative GPA is maintained. The scholarship may be renewed up to a maximum of seven semesters for an incoming freshman only.
All other classifications will receive the scholarship for the remaining semesters required to complete a four-year degree.
SELECTION OF RECIPIENT:
The University of Louisiana at Monroe TRiO Programs Office will select the recipient(s). The name of the recipient(s) shall be forwarded to the Scholarship Office as soon as a selection is made. more...

Recipient must be a sophomore, junior, or senior at the time of receiving the scholarship. more...

2. Recipient(s) must have a 3.0 GPA while in high school.
3. Recipient(s) must maintain a 3.0 GPA in order to renew the scholarship.
4. The scholarship shall be renewable for a maximum of four years. more...

Jennifer Frazer Doles Memorial Scholarship In Marriage & Family Therapy
The Jennifer Frazer Doles Memorial Scholarship in Marriage and Family Counseling Therapy is established to honor the memory of Jennifer Frazer Doles who through her commitment to excellence and love of humanity, dedicated her life and education to serving others. She felt that cohesiveness and strength in the family unit were paramount in the efforts of our society to positively impact the future of our nation. Therefore, it is fitting and proper that her legacy be preserved through this fund which will support and encourage others in this vital field of study.
CRITERIA FOR SELECTION:
1. Must be a graduate student enrolled in the Marriage and Family Therapy Program.
2. Must demonstrate financial need.
3. Renewable until graduation. more...

Jerry R. Sawyer Endowed Scholarship In Mathematics
Ben W. Collins donated the “Jerry R. Sawyer Endowed Scholarship in Mathematics” to Louisiana Tech University.

The scholarship recipient(s) must be registered and remain registered as a full-time student for the quarter in which he/she receives the scholarship at Louisiana Tech University.
The scholarship recipient(s) must be enrolled in a Mathematics curriculum.
The scholarship recipient(s) must be in the sophomore year’s curriculum in the Mathematics.
The student must maintain a minimum 3.0 GPA in Mathematics courses as well as a minimum 3.0 GPA in all other official college courses. more...

Jerry W. And Marianna Box Scholarship
Jerry W. and Marianna Box donated the “Jerry W. and Marianna Box Scholarship” to Louisiana Tech University.
Selection Criteria:
The scholarship recipient must be a citizen of the United States of America and must be registered and remain registered as a full-time student for the quarter in which he/she receives the scholarship at Louisiana Tech University.
The scholarship will be awarded to a student of Hispanic heritage who is pursuing an undergraduate degree in Engineering.
The recipient may receive the scholarship as a freshman and retain it through four consecutive years providing he/she maintains a 2.75 GPA on all course work. If a student is awarded the scholarship as a sophomore, he/she can regain the scholarship for three years, a junior for two years, and a senior for one year. more...

Jessie G. And Doniel B. Weil Memorial Scholarship
The Jessie G. and Doniel B. Weil Memorial Endowed Scholarship was established in honor and in memory of Jessie G. and Doniel B. Weil. The purpose is to provide scholarships to outstanding Ouachita Parish students who have exhibited fine citizenship and academic accomplishments.
1. Recipient(s) must be a full-time student from Ouachita Parish pursuing a bachelor’s degree at the University of Louisiana at Monroe.
2. Recipient(s) must meet university standards for acceptance in the University of Louisiana at Monroe. A university student must have a 2.75 cumulative GPA in college courses.
3. Scholarship is renewable if a 2.75 cumulative GPA is maintained. The scholarship may be renewed up to a maximum of 8 semesters for an incoming freshman only. All other classifications may receive the scholarship for the remaining semesters to complete a four year degree.
4. Recipient(s) must exemplify outstanding leadership qualities through involvement in community and educational organizations. more...

Jesuit Community Scholarship
Scholarship for Jesuit high school graduates who are undergraduate students attending Loyola University New Orleans. Selection based academic achievement, community involvement and leadership abilities. Due date, number of awards, and award amount may vary. more...

Jim And Faye Haddox Endowed Scholarship
The scholarship shall be named the Jim and Faye Haddox Endowed Scholarship, established by Jim and Faye Haddox to recognize the importance of higher education. Mr. and Mrs. Haddox are both graduates having earned bachelor degrees from the University of Louisiana at Monroe. The purpose is to provide scholarships for deserving students.
To qualify for the scholarship, a student must meet the following:
1. Recipient(s) must be a full-time junior or senior student pursuing a degree in Accounting, Finance, Pre-med/Biology, or Elementary Education.
2. Recipient(s) must meet university standards for acceptance in the University of Louisiana at Monroe. A university student must have a 3.3 cumulative GPA in college courses.
3. Scholarship is renewable if a 3.3 GPA is maintained. The scholarship may be renewed up to a maximum of four semesters for a junior only.
4. Recipient must demonstrate a high moral character and integrity.
5. Recipient must be a Louisiana resident. more...

Jim Barker Memorial Scholarship
Annual award for graduating high school senior from Ponchatoula High School who is an incoming freshman attending Southeastern Louisiana University full-time. Applicant must have a minimum 2.5 GPA and must have participated in Ponchatoula Youth Basketball. Due date varies. more...

Jim Hawkins Scholarship
*Established to express appreciation to the Epps School and community for allowing the Hawkins family to be a part.
1. Recipient(s) must be a graduate of Epps High School.
2. The award is for an entering freshman for one year (two semesters).
3. Recipient(s) must attend ULM and must only meet admissions standards. more...

John A. And Peter T. Beckish Memorial Scholarship
The scholarship shall be named the John A. and Peter T. Beckish Memorial Scholarship established by family and friends in honor and in memory of twin brothers, John A. and Peter T. Beckish following their untimely death due to an auto accident in Mississippi during Christmas break, 1967.

2. A university student must have a 2.5 cumulative GPA in college courses.
3. Scholarship is renewable if a 2.5 GPA is maintained. The scholarship may be renewed for the remaining semesters required to complete a four year degree. more...

John Andrew Colvin Memorial Scholarship
The John Andrew Colvin Memorial Scholarship was established by the Colvin family and friends in 1987 in honor and in memory of John Andrew Colvin, a Northeast Louisiana University agriculture student who loved nature and the land, and generously offered his friendship and support to all who knew him. In 2005 the scholarship was also designated in honor and in memory of Donna Martin Robbins, a 1985 graduate of Northeast Louisiana University School of Nursing who compassionately shared her talents, skills, and joy of living with her family, her patients, and her community. Northeast Louisiana University is now renamed ULM.
1. Recipient(s) must be a resident of Franklin Parish, Louisiana. If no one qualifies from Franklin Parish, the scholarship will be given to students who are residents of any other parish in north Louisiana.
2. Recipient(s) must major in Agriculture (Agribusiness) or Nursing, but at least one recipient annually must be pursuing a degree in Agriculture(Agribusiness).
3. If an incoming freshman, recipient(s) must have a B average in high school.
4. The scholarship is renewable if a cumulative 2.5 GPA is maintained in college courses. The scholarship may be renewed up to a maximum of eight semesters for an incoming freshman only. All other classifications may receive the scholarship for the remaining semesters required to complete a four-year degree. more...

Kappa Alpha - Cactus Jack Memorial Scholarship
To qualify for the scholarship, a student must meet the following:
A. Recipient(s) must be a full-time or part-time student pursuing their first undergraduate degree at the university.
B. Recipient(s) must be an active member of the Kappa Alpha Gamma Nu Chapter who is in good standing with the Fraternity and the University.
C. In the event of two equally qualified applicants, additional consideration will be given to an applicant from a single parent home.
D. Potential applicants will be interviewed by Cyd Page Jacobs, Joey Jacobs, or a person selected by them.
Students must apply through the ULM Scholarship Portal in the month of February. The ULM Foundation Scholarship manager will schedule an interview date with the Kappa Alpha – Cactus Jack Scholarship Committee and email eligible members the mandatory interview event information. Based on the recommendations submitted to the ULM Foundation Scholarship manager by the Kappa Alpha – Cactus Jack Committee, the ULM Scholarship Office will select the final recipients and notify the ULM Kappa Alpha President and the Kappa Alpha – Cactus Jack Scholarship Committee. more...

Kappa Alpha Fred Page Memorial Scholarship
The purpose is to provide scholarships each semester to a minimum of two active members of the Kappa Alpha, Gamma Nu Chapter (KA) who are in good standing with the Fraternity and the University. A minimum of $500 in the fall semester will be equally distributed to at least two deserving recipients. A minimum of $500 in the spring semester will be equally distributed to at least two deserving recipients.
A. Recipient(s) must be a full-time or part-time student pursuing their first undergraduate degree at the university.
B. Recipient(s) must be an active member of the Kappa Alpha Gamma Nu Chapter who is in good standing with the Fraternity and the University.
C. In the event of two equally qualified applicants, additional consideration will be given to an applicant from a single parent home.
D. Potential applicants will be interviewed by Cyd Page Jacobs, Joey Jacobs, or a person selected by them. more...

Karen Ohme Coon Endowed Memorial Scholarship
The Karen Lynn Ohme Coon Memorial Scholarship was established in memory of Karen, who was a 21 year old junior at Northeast Louisiana University when she died of cancer in 1991. She battled the disease much like she lived her life, courageously and with no regrets. Karen loved all people, without regard for race, cultural or ethnic background. She demonstrated kindness in her community without expectation of recognition or reward. When asked to lead, Karen used action rather than words. Karen had an outstanding work ethic and felt accomplishment from a job well done.
1. Recipient(s) must have a 2.75 GPA.
2. Recipient(s) should possess qualities similar to those of Karen.
3. To renew the scholarship, recipient(s) must maintain a 2.75 GPA. more...

Keith T. & Rita Hamilton Endowed Memorial Scholarship In Education

Ken And Mary Parnell Renwick Endowed Superior Graduate Scholarship
To qualify for the scholarship, a student must meet the following:
A. Recipient must meet ULM GRE requirements as defined by the Graduate School, with a minimum Graduate Record Examination (verbal + quantitative) converted score of 750.
B. Recipient must be enrolled as a full time student pursuing a master’s degree in Marriage and Family Therapy.
C. Recipient must have a minimum 3.50 undergraduate GPA.
D. The scholarship award will cover a one-academic-year period (continuous, for 12 months) and will be renewable for a second year, based upon satisfactory performance.
E. Recipient must maintain a GPA of 3.25 each semester, make significant progress in research, and remain enrolled as a full time student for continued funding. The Major Professor (Research Mentor) will determine student progress and report to the Director for the Marriage and Family Therapy Program by March 1 if progress is not being made. If the Major Professor reports that significant progress has not occurred, the Ken and Mary Parnell Renwick Endowed Superior Graduate Scholarship will be awarded to a new applicant at the beginning of the next academic year.
The Graduate School will provide the names of all applicants who meet the criteria listed above to the Scholarship Committee of the College of Health and Pharmaceutical Sciences. The Scholarship Committee will submit recommendations to the University Scholarship Office who will confirm eligibility and determine awards. more...

L. M. & C. C. Colvert Scholarship
The scholarship shall be named the Lottie Mae and C. C. Colvert Scholarship established by a bequest of Dr. & Mrs. Clyde Cornelius Colvert, in honor of his service as president of Ouachita Junior College from August 20, 1931 to October 31, 1944. Under the leadership and guidance of Dr. Colvert and the succeeding presidents, Ouachita Junior College has evolved into a renowned state university and is now renamed the University of Louisiana at Monroe. The purpose is to provide scholarships for deserving students.
To qualify for the scholarship, a student must meet the following:
1. Recipient(s) must be a graduate student pursuing a master’s degree in the Education.
2. A university student must have a 3.0 cumulative GPA in college courses.
3. Scholarship is renewable if a 3.0 GPA average is maintained. The scholarship may be renewed up to a maximum two year period. more...

L. M. Mckneely Endowed Scholarship Fund
This scholarship was established through an estate gift by Dr. Marvin McKneely, who served on the faculty of the ULM English Department from 1954 to 1980.
1. Recipient(s) must have demonstrated academic excellence and interest in the study of language and literature while pursuing a degree in English.
2. For this scholarship, academic excellence is the primary criterion.
3. Recipient(s) must maintain a 3.0 GPA to receive the scholarship for both semesters.
4. Recipient(s) will be selected on the basis of grades, recommendations, and a sample of the student’s writing.
5. Scholarhsip is renewable if 3.0 GPA is maintained in the major field of study.
6. Recipient(s) must demonstrate integrity and high moral character. more...

2. Recipient(s) must have a 3.0 GPA, either in college or in high school.
3. Scholarship is for one year only.
4. The scholarship will rotate through all the five colleges of the University, with a recipient being chosen from a different college each year. more...

The scholarship was established by Rakesh Karn in honor of his parents, Lalita and Janak Karn. The purpose is to provide scholarships for deserving the University of Louisiana at Monroe (ULM) students at Rakesh Karnâ€™s alma mater might have some of the same opportunities Rakesh provided through his loving parents.

2. Recipient(s) must meet university standards for acceptance in the ULM. Recipient(s) must have a minimum 3.0 cumulative GPA in college courses and must maintain the 3.0 GPA to be eligible for renewal funding in the spring semester.
3. Recipient(s) must demonstrate financial need.
4. Applicant(s) must submit a one-page essay describing how this award will help in achieving an educational goal.

Lanette S. Fisher Memorial Scholarship
Established to honor the memory of Mrs. Lanette Southall Fisher who taught in the public school systems of Louisiana from 1934 until her retirement in 1972. For 38 years she exhibited a sincere dedication to the education of young people in Louisiana, therefore, it is fitting that her family has chosen to establish a scholarship which will assist others to pursue the career she loved.
1. Must be at least a sophomore majoring in Education with a preference to those in elementary education.
2. Must be a full-time student at ULM with a cumulative grade point average of at least 3.0.
3. Must exhibit some financial need.
4. Must possess integrity and high moral character. more...

Lauren Lang Memorial Endowed Scholarship In Dental Hygiene
*CRITERIA FOR SELECTION: *
To qualify for the scholarship, a recipient(s) must meet the following:
A. Recipient(s) must meet university standards for acceptance in the University of Louisiana Monroe enrolled in the dental hygiene program. A university student must have a 3.0 cumulative GPA in college courses. Recipient must be full-time.
B. Scholarship is renewable if a 3.0 GPA is maintained. The scholarship may be renewed up to a maximum of seven semesters for an incoming freshman only. All other classifications may receive the scholarship for the remaining semesters required to complete a four-year degree.
C. Preference will be given to recipient(s) first from Northeast Louisiana (Union, Morehouse, West Carroll, East Carroll, Lincoln, Ouachita, Richland, Madison, Jackson, Caldwell, Franklin or Tensas Parish), and second to recipient(s) who are residents of the State of Louisiana.
D. Recipient(s) must submit a short essay during the annual application process per the attached instructions until such time as this requirement is removed. more...

Selection Criteria:
Student must be female.
Student must be a freshman home economics major in the School of Human Ecology at Louisiana Tech University.
Student must be a Louisiana resident.
Student must believe in the capitalistic free enterprise system and understand and appreciate the privileges and responsibilities of being an American citizen.
Student should demonstrate leadership potential by participating in home economics and other college activities.
Student must enroll in a full load of home economics courses.
Student must maintain a 3.0 average each quarter on at least 10 quarter hours of course work. more...

Selection Criteria:
Student must be a junior or senior home economics major in the School of Human Ecology at Louisiana Tech University. (A junior student shall have four to six quarters remaining at Tech following the award date.)
Student must be a Louisiana citizen.
Student must need financial assistance.
Student must believe in the capitalistic free enterprise system and understand and appreciate the privileges and responsibilities of being an American citizen.
Student should demonstrate leadership potential by participating in home economics and other college activities.
Student must enroll in a full load of home economics courses.
Student must maintain a 3.0 average each quarter on at least 10 quarter hours of course work.

Lipa Superior Graduate Student Scholarship In Pharmacy
To qualify for the scholarship, a student must meet the following:
A. Recipient must meet ULM admittance requirements as defined by the College of Pharmacy admissions committee, must be a holder of a Bachelor’s of Pharmaceutical Science degree, and be enrolled as a full time student pursuing a Doctor of Pharmacy degree (Pharm.D) within the College of Pharmacy.
B. The scholarship award will cover a two-academic-year period (continuous, four semesters) and will be non-renewable.
C. Recipient must maintain a GPA of 3.25 each semester.
D. Student must express a desire to be involved in the profession of independent pharmacy.
The University Scholarship Office will provide the names of all qualified applicants who meet the criteria listed above to the Scholarship Committee of the College of Pharmacy. The Scholarship Committee will submit recommendations to the University Scholarship Office who will confirm eligibility and determine final awards. more...

Louis Pierre Kappa Alpha Psi Annual Scholarship
A. Recipient(s) must be a graduating high school seniors enrolling into the University of Louisiana of Monroe that meet all the criteria for acceptance into University. The student can be a part-time or full-time student.
B. Special consideration shall be given for students who
(1) are members Kappa Alpha Psi Kappa League;
or
(2) have overcome obstacles such as socioeconomic or educational disadvantage;
or
(3) are the first generation in their family to attend college.
Selection criteria may be modified or
disregarded if determine in whole or in part to be contrary to law or then existing university
policy.
C. Scholarship is renewable if a 2.8 GPA is maintained. The scholarship may be renewed up to a maximum of 2 semesters for an incoming freshman only.
D.Applicant(s) must submit a typed 500-word essay addressing the topic of Leadership,Education and Community and a resume including educational background, work/volunteer history, extracurricular activities, honors, and skills. more...

_Established by the French family as a tribute to the memory of Lieutenant Colonel Travis A. French.
To qualify for the scholarship, a student must meet the following:
1. The recipient may be a full-time or part-time student pursuing their first undergraduate degree in School of Humanities.
2. Recipient(s) must meet university standards for acceptance in the University of Louisiana at Monroe. As an incoming freshman, recipient(s) must have a 2.5 cumulative GPA in high school. A university student must have a 2.5 cumulative GPA in college courses.
3. Scholarship is not renewable.
School of Humanities majors include: Communication, English, History, World Languages-French,World Languages-Spanish more...

Lucius Mcgehee Endowed Scholarship
Annual award for resident of Tangipahoa Parish, Louisiana who is an undergraduate student attending Southeastern Louisiana University full-time. Applicant must have a high school GPA of 2.5 or better or 2.5 for current college students. Due date and award amount varies. more...

Luffey First Generation Endowed Scholarship
To qualify for the scholarship, a recipient must meet the following:
A. Recipient(s) must be a resident of Louisiana.
B. Recipient(s) must be a “first-generation college student”, i.e. neither parent nor legal guardian(s) have earned a college degree.
C. Recipient(s) must be awarded the federal Pell grant.
D. Recipient(s) must meet university standards for acceptance in the University of Louisiana Monroe, must be admitted to the university, and must be pursuing their first undergraduate degree.
E. ULM will provide recipient(s) with structured support through active and engaged advising.
F. ULM will provide recipient(s) with meaningful campus employment of at least ten hours per week over and above the scholarship.
G. Preference will be given to recipient(s) who is a full-time student athlete.
The ULM Scholarship Office along with TRiO will select scholarship recipient(s). more...

Lula Ameen Freshman Art Scholarships
Scholarship for entering freshmen students accepted to Nicholls State University full-time, majoring in Art. Selection is based on high school GPA of at least 3.0, and the submission of ten completed works during the first week of May for faculty review. Number of awards varies. Non-renewable. more...

Lydia & Raymond Scully Scholarship
Scholarship for undergraduate students attending Loyola University New Orleans who are majoring in Visual Arts. Selection based academic achievement and financial need. Due date, number of awards, and award amount may vary. more...

Lynn L Leblanc Scholarship In Atmospheric Science
The Lynn L. LeBlanc Scholarship in Atmospheric Sciences was established by friends and students of Dr. LeBlanc to honor him for his years of service to the Atmospheric Science Program and his dedication to professional excellence. The purpose is to provide scholarships for deserving atmospheric science students.
To qualify for the scholarship, a student must meet the following:
1. Recipient(s) may be a full-time student pursuing a degree in Atmospheric Sciences.
2. As an incoming freshman, recipient(s) must have a 3.0 cumulative GPA in high school. A university student must have a 3.0 cumulative GPA in college courses.
3. Scholarship is renewable if a 3.0 GPA is maintained. The scholarship may be renewed up to a maximum of eight semesters for an incoming freshman only. All other classifications may receive the scholarship for the remaining semesters required to complete a four year degree. more...

Lynn Rowe Moore Communicative Disorder Scholarship
Established by friends and family in memory of Lynn Rowe Moore, and in tribute to her many years of dedication as a teacher and audiologist in the ULM Department of Communicative Disorders.
1. Recipient(s) must be an undergraduate student majoring in Speech-Language Pathology.
2. Recipient(s) must have completed 60 hours toward the Speech-Language Pathology degree.
3. Recipient(s) must have a minimum 3.4 overall GPA.
4. Recipient(s) must have successful progression in the major to the Professional Level. more...

Selection based academic achievement, community involvement and leadership abilities. Preference given to female students. Due date, number of awards, and award amount may vary. more...

Established by family and friends in memory of Mrs. Watson who loved teaching and gave so much of herself to the education profession.

A. Recipient(s) must be a student pursuing a degree in one of the foreign language programs offered at ULM; preference to be given to a major in Spanish.
B. Recipient(s) must have a 3.0 minimum cumulative GPA in high school as an incoming freshman or in college courses as a higher classification student in college.
C. Scholarship is renewable if recipient remains in foreign language studies and a 3.0 minimum GPA.
D. Scholarship may be used to support students enrolled in foreign language study abroad courses. more...

Graduate students must have an overall undergraduate GPA of 3.0 or better. Marilyn Frances And Louis J. St. Amant Superior Graduate Student Endowed Scholarship In Gerontology
To qualify for the scholarship, a student must meet the following:
A. Recipient must meet the requirements as defined by the ULM Graduate School and be enrolled as a full-time student pursuing a graduate degree in Gerontology.
B. Recipient must be a Louisiana resident.
C. Recipient must have and maintain a minimum 3.0 GPA.
D. The scholarship award will cover a four-academic-year period (continuous) and will be non-renewable.
The Graduate School will provide the names of all applicants who meet the criteria listed above to the Scholarship Committee of the College of Business and Social Sciences. The Scholarship Committee will submit recommendations to the University Scholarship Office who will confirm eligibility and determine awards. more...

Mary Davidson Memorial Nursing Scholarship
The Mary Davidson Memorial Nursing Scholarship was established by family and friends as a memorial to Mary Davidson. Mary showed her enthusiasm and love of life through unselfishly caring for and helping others. This scholarship recipient should continue enriching the lives of others with dedication and sincere caring.
1. Recipient(s) must be a Nursing major in the professional program who has successfully completed Level I with at least a 3.0 GPA.
2. Recipient(s) must exemplify qualities of caring, unselfishness, high moral character and dedication as exhibited by Mary Davidson.
3. Recipient(s) must be a graduate of a high school in northeast Louisiana with first priority given to Ouachita Parish graduates.
4. Recipient(s) must provide two letters of recommendation from their nursing instructors. Both should be from clinical instructors if the applicant has completed 2 or more levels.
5. If the above (#4) cannot be accomplished: Provide two names of nursing instructors for references who can be contacted by the Selection Committee should they desire to do so. more...

Mary Ellen Soignier Stapleton Endowed Scholarship
To qualify for the scholarship, a recipient must meet the following:
A. Recipient(s) may be a full-time or part-time student pursuing a degree in the College of Business and Social Sciences who has achieved sophomore classification or higher.
B. Recipient(s) must be a Louisiana resident who has completed prior education (high school, home school equivalent, or college) in the state of Louisiana.
C. Recipient(s) must work a minimum of 20 hours per week and submit a letter of recommendation from their employer(s) confirming their work schedule(s).
D. A university student must have a 3.0 minimum cumulative GPA in college courses.
E. Scholarship is renewable if a 3.0 minimum GPA is maintained. The scholarship may be renewed for the remaining semesters required to complete a four-year degree. Students must apply annually for the scholarship even if awarded in a prior year. more...

Mary Goss Charities First Generation Endowed Undergraduate Scholarship "A"
To qualify for the scholarship, a student must meet the following:
To qualify for the scholarship, a student must meet the following:
Recipient(s) must be a resident of Louisiana
Be a first-generation college student (your parents or guardians never earned a college degree) with financial need after the EFC (Estimated Family Contribution) and grants/scholarships are deducted or be a student, whether first-generation or not, who has been awarded the federal Pell grant and is admitted to the university during the semester(s) that the awards are disbursed.
Recipient(s) must meet university standards for acceptance at the University of Louisiana Monroe, must be admitted to the university, and must be pursuing their first undergraduate degree.
Scholarship may be renewed if a minimum 2.5 cumulative GPA is maintained. The scholarship may be renewed up to a maximum of seven semesters for an incoming freshman only.
All other classifications will receive the scholarship for the remaining semesters required to complete a four-year degree.
SELECTION OF RECIPIENT:
The University of Louisiana at Monroe TRiO Programs Office will select the recipient(s). The name of the recipient(s) shall be forwarded to the Scholarship Office as soon as a selection is made. more...

Matt Hattaway Endowed Scholarship Fund
The Matt Hattaway Scholarship was established by family and friends in honor and in memory of Matt Hattaway. The purpose is to provide scholarships for deserving construction students from the Caddo/Bossier area.
To qualify for the scholarship, a student must meet the following:
1. Recipient(s) must be an incoming full-time student pursuing a degree in Construction Management.
2. Recipient(s) must meet university standards for acceptance in the University of Louisiana at Monroe.
3. Scholarship is renewable if a 3.0 GPA is maintained. The scholarship may be renewed up to a maximum of four academic years for an incoming freshman recipient.
4. If a qualified student is available, it is preferred to choose a recipient from the Caddo/Bossier area.
5. The university will arrange an opportunity for the Hattaway/Nichols family to meet the scholarship recipient on an annual basis. more...

Mauri Anne Hancock Memorial Nursing Scholarship
The Mauri Anne Hancock Memorial Nursing Scholarship was established by family and friends as a memorial to Mauri Anne Hancock, a native of Monroe and a seventh generation great-granddaughter of Don Juan Filhiol, the founder of Fort Miro (Monroe). She was a member of the Daughters of the American Revolution and a 1980 nursing graduate of Northeast Louisiana University. Mauri Anne’s life was spent aiding others with her dedicated and caring attitude to the profession of nursing.
1. Recipient(s) must be in the professional Nursing Program.
2. Recipient(s) must have a 3.0 GPA, and must maintain a 3.0 GPA in order to renew the scholarship.
3. Recipient(s) must typify the qualities of dedication and competence for which the nursing profession has been traditionally and rightly honored.
4. Recipient(s) must be a graduate of a high school in Ouachita Parish. more...

Melray Scurlock Endowed Scholarship
To qualify for the scholarship, a recipient must meet the following:
Recipient(s) must be a full-time student and in good standing with the university.
Recipient(s) must maintain a 2.5 cumulative GPA to receive the scholarship.
The scholarship may be awarded to the same student for multiple years of his/ her college career, not to exceed four years.
The scholarship shall be intended to assist the recipient(s) in paying any college education costs that would otherwise be paid to The University of Louisiana- Monroe by the student.

First preference in awarding the scholarship(s) shall be given to a student who is a direct descendant of Clarence Ray Scurlock and Melba G. Scurlock. Should more than one student meet this qualification, the scholarship will be awarded evenly to all students meeting this preference. In the event there are no candidates meeting this preference, the scholarship may be awarded to any student at the University of Louisiana-Monroe who meet all the criteria. more...

Melray Scurlock Family Endowed Scholarship
First preference shall be given to a descendant of Clarence Ray Scurlock and Melba G. Scurlock.
Second preference shall be given to students who reside or who once resided at the Methodist Children’s Home, Ruston, Louisiana.
Third preference shall be given to any student at Louisiana Tech University. more...

Meriels Legacy Scholarship
Annual award for minority undergraduate student attending Southeastern Louisiana University full-time, majoring in Elementary Education with an interest in Developmental or Education Psychology. Applicant must have a minimum 3.0 GPA, have completed at least 30 credit hours in the program (with at least 3 hours completed beyond the core curriculum). Submit copy of most recent IRS income tax return to demonstrate financial need (may outweigh GPA), three letters of recommendation, essay and transcript with application packet. Renewable. more...
