The Merit Scholarship is available to entering freshmen at Dillard University. You must have a minimum 2.8 GPA and at least a 19 ACT / 990 SAT score to be eligible for this award. more...

Merit Scholarship - Southeastern Louisiana University
The Merit Scholarship is open to entering freshmen at Southeastern Louisiana University. You must be a National Merit finalist or semi-finalist to be eligible for this renewable award. more...

Merle Burk Endowed Scholarship
Merle Burk Estate donated the “Merle Burk Endowed Scholarship” to Louisiana Tech University.
Selection Criteria:
The recipient must be a full-time student majoring in the School of Human Ecology at Louisiana Tech University.
Part-time student majors may be considered for a scholarship if a financial need exists.
The scholarship may be awarded to a Senior student.
Prime consideration shall be given to an applicant with outstanding academic promise.
Scholarship recipients must maintain a 3.0 GPA on a 4.0 system and be enrolled in at least one human ecology course each quarter. more...

Michael Brice Endowment Memorial Scholarship
The Michael Brice Memorial Scholarship was established by family and friends as a memorial to Michael Brice, a native of Monroe and 1976 graduate of ULM. Michael was loved deeply by his family and many friends in northeast Louisiana and the Dallas/Ft. Worth area.
1. Recipient(s) must be a full-time student pursuing a degree in Accounting.
2. Recipient(s) must have an overall 3.0 GPA in high school or college.
3. Recipient(s) must maintain a 3.0 GPA in order the renew the scholarship.
4. Priority will be given to Ouachita Parish residents and/or Louisiana residents. more...

Michael Fanning Scholarship
Annual award for an undergraduate student attending Southeastern Louisiana University full-time, majoring in English, English Education, Journalism or Liberal Arts. Applicant must have a 3.5 GPA and have completed 30 credit hours at Southeastern; and be eligible to graduate within one school year. Due date varies. more...

Michael Joseph Raymond Memorial Scholarship
To qualify for the scholarship, a recipient must meet the following:
A. The recipient must be a full-time student who has achieved a Junior classification or higher pursuing a major in Psychology with a special interest in working with individuals which are experiencing developmental disabilities and I or are mentally challenged (i.e. physically handicapped, mentally retarded, traumatic brain injury).
B. Recipient must have a 3.0 cumulative GPA in college courses.
C. Scholarship is renewable if a 3.0 GPA is maintained. Recipient(s) may receive the scholarship for the remaining semesters required to complete a four-year degree but must apply each year.
D. Donor’s intent is to assist students who have a financial need as evidenced by the Student Aid Report (SAR) received by the university after the FAFSA process is complete each year and who might otherwise be unable to attend college without this scholarship. Students who are eligible for federal educational grants which do not have to be repaid, such as Federal Pell Grants, are not eligible for this scholarship, absent very extenuating circumstances . The Admissions Office shall have the latitude to make such a decision keeping in mind the original intent of this donation. more...

Michael Todd Johnson Memorial Scholarship
The scholarship shall be called the Michael Todd Johnson Memorial Scholarship.
1. Recipient(s) must be a graduate of Neville High School – if Neville no longer exists, recipient(s) must be a graduate of a high school within Ouachita Parish.
2. Recipient(s) must be a full-time student pursuing his/her first undergraduate degree.
3. As an incoming freshman, recipient(s) must have a 2.5 cumulative GPA in high school. A university student must have a 2.5 cumulative GPA in college courses.
4. Scholarship is renewable if a 2.5 average is maintained. The scholarship maybe renewed up to a maximum of eight semesters for an incoming freshman only. All other classifications may receive the scholarship for the remaining semesters required to completer a four year degree. more...

Michel Family Endowed Scholarship
To qualify for the scholarship, a recipient must meet the following:
A. Recipient(s) may be a full-time student pursuing a degree in Risk Management and Insurance.
B. Recipient(s) must be accepted into an internship.
C. Recipient must have a 3.0 cumulative GPA in college courses.
D. Scholarship is renewable if the student maintains a 3.0 GPA.
E. Recipient must meet university standards for acceptance at ULM.
F. Must be a United States citizen.
G. Donorâ€™s intent is to assist students who have a financial need as evidenced by the Student Aid Report (SAR) received by the university after the FAFSA process is complete each year and who might otherwise be unable to attend college without this scholarship. Students who are eligible for federal educational grants which do not have to be repaid, such as Federal Pell Grants, are not eligible for this scholarship, absent very extenuating circumstances. The Admissions Office shall have the latitude to make such a decision keeping in mind the original intent of this donation. more...

Mike Bauer Memorial Scholarship
Scholarship for undergraduate juniors or seniors attending Nicholls State University full-time, majoring in Economics or Finance. Number of awards and award amount varies. more...

Mike Thompson Memorial Endowed Scholarship
Satterfield & Pontikes Construction, Inc. donated the “Mike Thompson Memorial Endowed Scholarship” to Louisiana Tech University.
Selection Criteria:
Student must be registered and remain registered a full-time student for the quarter in which he/she receives the scholarship at Louisiana Tech University.
Student must be in the College of Engineering and Science majoring in Construction Engineering Technology.
Student must have a minimum 2.5 GPA. more...

Miller Brewing Company Freshman Academic Scholarship
Scholarship for residents of the Assumption, Lafourche, or Tennebonne Parishes, Louisiana who are incoming freshmen students attending Nicholls State University full-time. Applicants must have a minimum 3.0 GPA. One recipient will be chosen from each of the following marketing areas: Louisiana Beer (Assumption); Delta Distributing (Lafourche); Svoboda Distributing (Terrebonne). Award amount varies. more...

Miller-(Dr. Agness Chambless) Endowed Scholarship
Selection Criteria:
Student must have a major within the School of Human Ecology.
Student must be enrolled full-time in the quarter in which the scholarship is received.
Student must maintain a minimum 3.0 cumulative GPA.
First preference is given to a student from Louisiana. more...

Milton And Bertha Marie Masur Gorn Scholarship
Established by Bertha Marie Masur Gorn.
To qualify for the scholarship, a student must meet the following:
A. Recipient(s) must be resident(s) of Ouachita Parish.
B. Donor intent is to assist students who have a financial need as evidenced by the Student Aid Report (SAR) received by the university after the FAFSA process is complete each year and who might otherwise be unable to attend college without this scholarship. Students who are eligible for federal educational grants which do not have to be repaid, such as Federal Pell Grants, are not eligible for this scholarship, absent very extenuating circumstances. The Admissions Office shall have the latitude to make such a decision keeping in mind the original intent of this donation.
C. Recipient(s) may be a full-time or part-time student pursuing their first undergraduate degree and must meet university standards for acceptance in the University of Louisiana at Monroe.
D. Scholarship is renewable if a 2.5 GPA is maintained. The scholarship may be renewed up to a maximum of eight semesters for an incoming freshman only. All other classifications may receive the scholarship for the remaining semesters required to complete a four year degree. more...

Mimi Pratte Memorial Endowed Scholarship
Criteria for Selection:
Recipients(s) MUST be a non-traditional female student (a recipient starting or having started her post-secondary education at the age of 22 or older, or the recipient is a continuing or returning student who is 24 or older)) pursuing an undergraduate degree within the College of Arts, Education, and Sciences.
Recipient(s) must meet university standards for acceptance in the University of Louisiana Monroe. Recipient(s) must have a college GPA of 2.0 for current or returning students or meet the minimum entrance requirements for incoming students.
Scholarship is not renewable.
Recipient(s) must have an economic need as determined by her FAFSA score.
Preference will be given to documented cancer survivors or victims. Optional essay discussing post-graduation plans may also be considered in awarding the scholarship. more...

Minnie Bond Scholarship
Annual award for resident of Livingston Parish, Louisiana who is an undergraduate junior attending Southeastern Louisiana University, majoring in Education. Due date varies. more...

Minnie Bond Scholarship
The Minnie Bond Scholarship is available to education majors at Southeastern Louisiana University. You must be a junior from Livingston Parish to be eligible for this award more...

Minor & Louella Cheramie Endowed Scholarship
Annual award for Lafourche Parish, Louisiana resident who is a graduating high school senior from South Lafourche High School accepted at Nicholls State University full-time. Applicant must have qualified for the Tuition Opportunity Program for Students (TOPS). Student must maintain an overall GPA of at least 2.5. Renewable; eight semesters. more...

Minority Male Scholars In Education Scholarship
Scholarship for graduates of a Louisiana high school who are minority male undergraduate students attending Southeastern Louisiana University full-time, majoring in Education. Incoming freshmen must have a minimum ACT score of 22 or an ACT score of 20 with a GPA of at least 3.0. Current college students must have a minimum 3.0 GPA. Award is set up as a loan with principal and interest forgiven if recipients teach full-time in a public or other non-profit school. Number of awards varies. more...

Mitchiner - Gittinger Endowed Scholarship
Established by the Mitchiner-Gittinger Family Foundation in memory of Howard Gittinger, Jr. and Nantelle Mitchiner Gittinger.
1. Recipient(s) must be an entering freshman.
2. Recipient(s) must be a graduate of a public or private high school in East Carroll Parish.
3. Each award shall be a one-time award to an entering freshman.
4. Scholarship is not renewable. more...

Monroe District Nurses Association Scholarship Endowment
The scholarship shall be called the Monroe District Nurses Association Scholarship.
1. Recipient(s) must be in the professional Nursing Program.
2. Recipient(s) must have at least a 2.5 GPA.
3. Recipient(s) must reside in one of the following Northeast Louisiana Parishes: Ouachita, East Carroll, West Carroll, Madison, Richland, Tensas, Franklin, Caldwell, and Morehouse.
4. The value of the scholarship(s) may vary per recipient(s) and be awarded in a semester or summer term.
5. Recipient(s) must typify the image of professional nursing.
6. Preference is to be given to a relative by blood or marriage of members of Monroe District Nurses Association. more...

Monroe-West Monroe Business & Professional Women Scholarship
Established by the Monroe-West Monroe Business & Professional Women’s Organization for the purpose of providing a scholarship for a worthy young woman.
1. Preference will be given to a female student, aged 25 years or older (non-traditional student) and may be a full-time or part-time student.
2. Recipient must have a 2.5 GPA, and must maintain a 2.5 GPA to renew the scholarship.
3. Recipient must be in good standing with the University.
4. Recipient must be enrolled in a formal degree path program or formal professional certification program. more...

2. Scholarship will be awarded each year to an incoming freshman.
3. Scholarship is not renewable. more...

Musicianship Scholarship
The Musicianship Scholarship is available to full-time incoming freshmen students at Tulane University. You must demonstrate a history of talent and dedication to music to be eligible for this award. You must apply to one of the following concentrations: Jazz Studies, Music Composition, Music Performance (Instrumental), Music Performance (Vocal), or Musical Theatre. Selection is based in-part on a portfolio submission. more...

Myra C. Lillard Scholarship In Family & Consumer Sciences
Scholarship for undergraduate sophomore (1) and juniors (2) attending Southeastern Louisiana University full-time, majoring in Family and Consumer Sciences. One award is given to a junior with highest GPA; second award given to junior with second highest GPA; and third award given to a sophomore with highest GPA. No application is necessary as awards are based on GPA. If two students tie with GPA, student with greatest leadership will be selected. Due date and award amount varies. more...

Applicants must have a minimum 2.5 GPA or better. Students must apply by writing a letter to the Dean of the School of Nursing requesting that they be considered for a scholarship. 3. Recipient(s) must be a person of integrity and high moral character.
4. The scholarship is non-renewable. more...

Nancy Hiller Shank Memorial Endowed Scholarship
Janie Fitzgerald and Daniel Shank donated the “Nancy Hiller Shank Memorial Endowed Scholarship” to Louisiana Tech University.
Selection Criteria:
Student must be registered and remain registered as a full-time student for the quarter in which he/she receives the scholarship at Louisiana Tech University.
Student must be a female majoring in Computer Science or an Engineering Curriculum.
Student must maintain at least a minimum 2.5 GPA in all official college courses.
First preference in awarding the scholarship will be given to a student who is a member of Sigma Kappa sorority majoring preferably in Computer Science or in any engineering curriculum.
Second preference in awarding the scholarship will be given to a female student who is majoring preferably in Computer Science or in any other engineering curriculum. more...

Nancy Lowery Scholarship
To qualify for the scholarship, a recipient must meet the following:
A. Recipient(s) may be a full-time or part-time student pursuing a degree in Nursing.
B. Recipient(s) must meet university standards for acceptance in the University of Louisiana Monroe. As an incoming freshman, recipient(s) must have a 3.25 cumulative GPA in high school. A university student must have a 3.0 minimum cumulative GPA in college courses.
C. Scholarship is renewable if a 3.0 minimum GPA is maintained. The scholarship may be renewed up to a maximum of eight semesters for an incoming freshman only. All other classifications may receive the scholarship for the remaining semesters required to complete a four-year degree.
D. Donorsâ€™ intent is to assist students who have a financial need as evidenced by the Student Aid Report (SAR) received by the university after the FAFSA process is complete each year and who might otherwise be unable to attend college without this scholarship. Students who are eligible for federal educational grants which do not have to be repaid, such as Federal Pell Grants, are not eligible for this scholarship, absent very extenuating circumstances. The Admissions Office shall have the latitude to make such a decision keeping in mind the original intent of this donation.
E. Preference will be given to students from Richland, Ouachita and Franklin parishes. The family may opt to make recommendations for specific candidates. more...

Nancy M. Christian Scholarship
Scholarship for incoming freshmen planning to attend Centenary College of Louisiana full-time. Candidates will be selected to attend Scholars Weekend in March to compete for the scholarships. Selection based on strength of high school curriculum, GPA, ACT/SAT scores, quality of essay, range and type of extracurricular activities, maturity, and leadership capacity. Award is equal to full tuition, fees, room & board. Renewable; maintain 3.0 GPA. more...

This scholarship was established by the siblings of Mrs. Lenard, Ryan, Ashlee, Robert Edward II, and Bentz and Elmore, Inc.
To qualify for the scholarship, a recipient must meet the following:
A. Recipient(s) must be a full-time graduate student in either History or English. Primary preference will be given to students pursuing a degree in History and secondary preference to those pursuing a degree in English.
B. Recipient(s) must meet university standards for acceptance in the University of Louisiana Monroe. As a graduate student, recipient(s) must have a 3.0 cumulative GPA in college courses.
C. Scholarship is not renewable. more...

Ned Wright Endowment Memorial Scholarship
Established by friends and family in memory of Ned Wright, who had a deep faith in young people and realized the importance of education. The purpose is to provide scholarships for deserving history students.
1. Recipient(s) must be a full-time student pursuing their first undergraduate degree in History.
2. Recipient(s) must meet university standards for acceptance in the University of Louisiana at Monroe. Recipient(s) must have completed a minimum of 30 hours and must have a 3.0 cumulative GPA in college courses.
3. Scholarship is renewable if a 3.0 GPA is maintained. The scholarship may be renewed for the remaining semesters required to complete a four year degree. more...

Neil H. Douglas Scholarship In Vertebrate Zoology
A. Recipient(s) must be enrolled full-time as an undergraduate pursuing a degree in Biology with special interest in vertebrate zoology
B. Recipient(s) must have completed at least thirty semester hours of course work with a cumulative GPA of at least 2.5 and a GPA of at least 2.75 in biology course work
C. Financial need will be a factor only when two more applicants are considered academically equivalent. In such cases, the applicant with the greater demonstrated financial need will be favored.
D. Scholarship holders may apply for renewals for up to two additional years (assuming funds are available). However, renewal applicants must have maintained a 2.5 cumulative GPA and earned a biology GPA of 3.0 on a minimum of 24 semester hours during the funded academic year. A new application will be required and renewals will compete with first-time applicants.
Selection of the recipient(s) will be made by the Scholarship Committee that consists of faculty members of the Department of Biology. If during a given year the applicant pool is weak or interest income is low, the Committee may choose not to award a scholarship. Selections will be submitted to the ULM Scholarship Office. more...

The scholarship shall be names the Nick Dimos College of Business Scholarship established by family and friends in memory of Nick Dimos. The purpose is to provide scholarships for deserving students.
1. Recipient(s) must be a full-time student pursuing their first undergraduate degree in the College of Business & Social Sciences.
2. As an incoming freshman, recipient(s) must have a 2.5 GPA in high school. A university student must have a 2.5 cumulative GPA in college courses.
3. Scholarship is renewable if a 2.5 GPA is maintained. The scholarship will be renewed up to a maximum of seven semesters for an incoming freshman only. All other classifications will receive the scholarship for the remaining semesters required to complete a four year degree. more...

Noel Foundation Continuing Student Scholarship
1. Student must have attended LSUS the past two semesters
2 Student must have an undergraduate GPA of at least 3.0
3. Student must be enrolling as a full-time student each fall and spring semester (12 or more hours)
4. Student must have earned at least 60 hours, but not more than 120 more...

Noel Foundation Inc. Transfer Scholarship
1. Student must be an incoming transfer student
2. Student must possess a cumulative GPA of at least 2.5
3. Student must not have attempted more than 90 college hours
4. Student will be attending LSUS as a full-time student (12 or more hours)
5. Student must have majored in a program or course of study that leads to a Bachelor’s Degree at LSUS
6. Student must be registered at LSUS for the first time in the year of award.
This scholarship cannot be combined with LSUS’s Guaranteed Scholarships, such as the Transfer Scholarship. If awarded both, you will have the option to choose which scholarship to apply to your account. more...

Northeast Louisiana Society For Human Resource Management Scholarship
Established by the Northeast Louisiana Society for Human Resource Management to provide scholarships for students interested in a career in human resource management or other business field.
1. The recipient may be a full-time or part-time student pursuing their first undergraduate degree majoring in the accredited business program areas in the College of Business & Social Sciences. Preference will be given to management majors.
2. Recipient(s) must be a junior or senior with a 2.5 cumulative GPA in college courses.
3. The scholarship will be awarded on an annual basis. The student must have a 2.5 GPA upon completion of fall semester to receive the scholarship in the spring.
4. Preference shall be given to students who have family members of the Northeast Louisiana Society for Human Resource Management. more...

Northwest Louisiana Ulm Alumni Chapter Scholarship (Formerly Caddo/Bossier Alumni Scholarship)
A.The recipient may be a full-time student pursuing their first undergraduate degree.
B. As an incoming freshman, recipient(s) must have a 2.75 cumulative GPA in high school. A university student must have a 2.75 cumulative GPA in college courses.
C. Recipient(s) must have graduated from a high school in the Caddo/Bossier Alumni Chapter area. The recipient’s parent(s) or legal guardian must have a permanent residence in the Caddo/Bossier Alumni Chapter area on the date application is made for the scholarship and as of the date of approval of the scholarship. Permanent residence is defined as living in the Caddo/Bossier Alumni Chapter area more than fifty percent (50%) of the most recent calendar year.
D.The scholarship award may be renewable if a 2.75 GPA average is maintained. The scholarship may be renewed up to a maximum of eight semesters for an incoming freshman only. All other classifications may receive the scholarship for the remaining semesters required to complete a four year degree. more...

Nortrax / Lapa Scholarship
The Nortrax / LAPA Scholarship is available to full-time students in the College of Engineering at Louisiana State University. You must be a sophomore or junior majoring in civil engineering and taking a hot mix asphalt technology course to be eligible for this award. more...

The Nortrax/LAPA Scholarship is available to full-time sophomores and juniors at the University of Louisiana. You must be majoring in civil engineering and have taken a hot mix asphalt technology course to be eligible for this award. more...

Oib (Ouachita Independent Bank) Endowed Scholarship
The scholarship was established by stockholders and friends to commemorate the positive impact this bank had on the North Louisiana community before it became BancorpSouth on January 15, 2018. The purpose is to provide scholarships for deserving students.
To qualify for the scholarship, a recipient must meet the following:
A. Recipient(s) may be a full-time student pursuing a degree in the School of Accounting, Financial & Information Services, or the School of Management.
B. Scholarship is renewable if a 3.0 minimum GPA is maintained. The scholarship may be renewed up to a maximum of seven semesters for an incoming freshman only. All other classifications may receive the scholarship for the remaining semesters required to complete a four-year degree. more...

Orchestra Scholarships
Scholarship for undergraduate or graduate students enrolled full-time at the University of Louisiana-Lafayette School of Music. Students must belong to the University orchestra. An audition is required. Deadlines and award amounts may vary. more...

Orleans A. & Louella Pitre Endowed Scholarship
Annual award for a graduating high school senior from South Lafourche High School who has been accepted to Nicholls State University full-time. Applicant must have qualified for TOPS (Tuition Opportunity Program for Students). Renewable; maintain 2.5 GPA. more...

Oscar Cahn And Kurt And Irmgard Fisher Scholarship
The scholarship has been named the Oscar Cahn and Kurt and Irmgard Fisher Scholarship established by family and friends in honor and in memory of Oscar Cahn, Irmgard Cahn Fisher and Kurt Fisher and the purpose is to provide scholarships for deserving students.
1. Recipient(s) must be a resident of Louisiana.
2. Donor intent is to assist students who have a financial need as evidenced by the Student Aid Report (SAR) received by the university after the FAFSA process is complete each year and who might otherwise be unable to attend college without this scholarship. Students who are eligible for federal educational grants which do not have to be repaid, such as Federal Pell Grants, are not eligible for this scholarship, absent very extenuating circumstances. The Admissions Office shall have the latitude to make such a decision keeping in mind the original intent of this donation.
3. Recipient(s) may be a full-time or part-time student pursuing their first undergraduate degree and must meet university standards for acceptance in the University of Louisiana at Monroe.
4. Scholarship is renewable if a 2.5 GPA is maintained. The scholarship may be renewed up to a maximum of eight semesters for an incoming freshman only. All other classifications may receive the scholarship for the remaining semesters required to complete a four year degree. more...

Otto E. Passman Scholarship
The Otto Passman Endowment Scholarship was funded from a bequest from Mr. Passman.
To qualify for the scholarship, a student must meet the following:
A. Recipient(s) must be a resident of Ouachita Parish.
B. Donor intent is to assist students who have a financial need as evidenced by the Student Aid Report (SAR) received by the university after the FAFSA process is complete each year and who might otherwise be unable to attend college without this scholarship. Students who are eligible for federal educational grants which do not have to be repaid, such as Federal Pell Grants, are not eligible for this scholarship, absent very extenuating circumstances. The Admissions Office shall have the latitude to make such a decision keeping in mind the original intent of this donation.
C. Recipient(s) may be a full-time or part-time student pursuing their first undergraduate degree and must meet university standards for acceptance in the University of Louisiana at Monroe.
D. Scholarship is not renewable. more...

Ouachita National Bank Education Trust Fund Scholarship
The Ouachita National Bank Educational Trust Fund was established in 1953 to provide scholarships for students from the service areas of JP Morgan Chase, N. A. (formerly Ouachita National Bank in Monroe.)
1. Recipient(s) must be a full-time student majoring in Business Administration or Finance.
2. Recipient(s) must have a 3.0 GPA.
3. Recipient(s) must be a person of integrity and high moral character.
4. Recipient(s) must be a high school graduate from the following parishes: Ouachita, Morehouse, Richland, Franklin, Caldwell, Jackson, Lincoln and Union.
5. Scholarship is renewable with a 3.0 GPA. more...

Ouachita Parish Women's Republican Club 1St Generation Scholarship
This scholarship was established by the Ouachita Parish Women’s Republican Club in honor and memory of Billy G. Haynes.
To qualify for the scholarship, a student must meet the following:
Recipient(s) must be a resident of Louisiana
Be a first-generation college student (your parents or guardians never earned a college degree) with financial need after the EFC (Estimated Family Contribution) and grants/scholarships are deducted or be a student, whether first-generation or not, who has been awarded the federal Pell grant and is admitted to the university during the semester(s) that the awards are disbursed.
Recipient(s) must meet university standards for acceptance at the University of Louisiana Monroe, must be admitted to the university, and must be pursuing their first undergraduate degree.
Scholarship may be renewed if a minimum 2.5 cumulative GPA is maintained. The scholarship may be renewed up to a maximum of seven semesters for an incoming freshman only.
All other classifications will receive the scholarship for the remaining semesters required to complete a four-year degree.
SELECTION OF RECIPIENT:
Donor more...

A. The recipient must be a full-time graduate student pursuing a degree in Education.
B. Recipient(s) must have a minimum 3.0 cumulative GPA in college courses.
C. Scholarship is not renewable. more...

Out Of State Fee Waiver (Group 1)
Scholarship for incoming freshmen planning to attend full-time at the University of Louisiana-Lafayette. Students must have a minimum 2.5 CGPA, a minimum 23 ACT score or a minimum 1060 SAT score, have earned less than 12 credits of college work, and are non-residents. Deadlines and award amounts may vary. more...

Out Of State Fee Waiver (Group 2)
Scholarship for transfer undergraduate students enrolled full-time at the University of Louisiana-Lafayette. Students must have a minimum 2.75 CGPA, completed a minimum of 12 credit hours, and have no need for remedial course work. Deadlines and award amounts may vary. more...

Out Of State Fee Waiver (Group 3)
Scholarship for undergraduate students enrolled full-time at the University of Louisiana-Lafayette. Students must have a minimum 2.5 CGPA if entering freshmen or have earned a minimum of 24 transferable college credits, demonstrate leadership, and talent in dance, debate, visual arts, music, or theatre. Consideration given to students in cheerleading, flag corps, and spirit groups that perform at athletic events. An interview is required. Deadlines and award amounts may vary. more...

To qualify for the scholarship, a student must meet the following:
Recipient(s) must be a resident of Louisiana
Be a first-generation college student (your parents or guardians never earned a college degree) with financial need after the EFC (Estimated Family Contribution) and grants/scholarships are deducted or be a student, whether first-generation or not, who has been awarded the federal Pell grant and is admitted to the university during the semester(s) that the awards are disbursed.
Recipient(s) must meet university standards for acceptance at the University of Louisiana Monroe, must be admitted to the university, and must be pursuing their first undergraduate degree.
Scholarship may be renewed if a minimum 2.5 cumulative GPA is maintained. The scholarship may be renewed up to a maximum of seven semesters for an incoming freshman only.

Paul Howard Kitchens Memorial Scholarship
Established by the Bill Kitchens family in memory of their son/brother, Paul Howard Kitchens, who exemplified excellence in academics and athletics.
1. Recipient(s) must meet university standards for acceptance in the University of Louisiana at Monroe. As an incoming freshman, recipient(s) must have a 2.75 cumulative GPA in high school. A university student must have a 2.75 cumulative GPA in college courses.
2. Recipient(s) must be residents of Louisiana and:
(1) ULM students currently enrolled in The ULM School of Behavioral & Social Sciences/Criminal Justice or Social Work, or Occupational Therapy
(2) High school seniors graduating from schools within the parish (Ouachita,
Monroe City, and private schools) who plan to major in The ULM School of Behavioral & Social Sciences/Criminal Justice or Social Work.
3. Scholarship is renewable if a 2.75 GPA is maintained. The scholarship may be renewed up to a maximum of eight semesters for an incoming freshman only. All other classifications may receive the scholarship for the remaining semesters required to complete a four year degree. Recipients must reapply for consideration in following semesters.
4. Recipient (s) must demonstrate academic excellence, leadership qualities, and service to their respective schools. more...

Phil Israel Engineering Scholarship
Phil Israel donated the “Phil Israel Engineering Scholarship” to Louisiana Tech University.
Selection Criteria:
The scholarship recipient(s) must be registered and remain registered as a full-time student for the quarter in which he/she receives the scholarship at Louisiana Tech University.
A four-year scholarship will be awarded to an incoming freshman student who is a graduate of Captain Shreve High School in Shreveport, Louisiana, who will be majoring in a curriculum within the College of Engineering and Science.
The scholarship recipient must have participated in the Engineering Magnet Program and must have a high school cumulative GPA of 3.0.
The scholarship will be awarded based upon teacher recommendations taking into account student academic achievement and participation in athletics and/or other extracurricular activities.
To retain the award for 4 years, the student must continue to be a COES major and maintain a minimum 2.75 GPA. more...

A. Recipient must meet ULM GRE requirements as defined by the Graduate School and be enrolled as a full time student pursuing a graduate degree in Marriage and Family Therapy or Counseling Studies.
B. Recipient must have a minimum 3.0 undergraduate GPA.
C. The scholarship award will cover a two-academic-year period (continuous, Fall, Spring, and Summer semesters) and will be non-renewable.
D. Recipient must maintain a GPA of 3.25 each semester. more...

Mrs. Patricia Gage donated the “Rev. and Mrs. W. R. Gage Endowed Scholarship in Human Ecology” to Louisiana Tech University to help support students majoring in Human Ecology.
Selection Criteria:
The scholarship recipient(s) must be registered and remain registered as a full-time student for the quarter in which he/she receives the scholarship at Louisiana Tech University.
The scholarship recipient shall be enrolled in a Human Ecology curriculum.
The scholarship recipient must have completed the junior year’s curriculum in the Human Ecology curriculum.
Student must have a minimum 3.0 GPA in all official college courses in order to receive the scholarship; however, discretion may be used in extenuating circumstances should the GPA drop below a 3.0 during the senior year. more...

Students completing this program are commissioned as officers in their respective branch of the armed forces upon graduation. Contact the commanding officer at Tulane for the particular service in which student is interested (i.e. Air Force, Army, Navy). more...

Scholarship for undergraduate students attending Southeastern Louisiana University full-time. Applicants must have a minimum 2.5 GPA (for financial based awards), or a 3.5 GPA (for scholastic based awards). Submit one-page essay discussing career plans and how award will benefit student with application packet. Due date and number of awards varies. more...

Tangipahoa Parish Medical Auxiliary Scholarship
Annual award for undergraduate sophomore or above attending Southeastern Louisiana University full-time, majoring in Nursing. Student may apply by writing the Dean of the School of Nursing requesting they be considered for a scholarship. Due date varies. more...

Tangipahoa Parish Retired Teachers Association Scholarship
Annual award for undergraduate student attending Southeastern Louisiana University full-time, majoring in Education. Applicant must be one of the top five juniors in the College of Education. Due date varies. more...

Tangipahoa Parish Teachers Credit Union Scholarship
Scholarship for undergraduate students attending Southeastern Louisiana University full-time, majoring in Education. Due date varies. more...

Taylor Jeansonne Endowed Scholarship In Industrial Technology
Annual award for undergraduate student attending Southeastern Louisiana University full-time, majoring in Industrial Technology. Student must have a minimum 3.0 high school GPA or a 2.75 college GPA. Applicant must exhibit good moral character and strong work ethic. Due date and award amount varies. more...

Terell Foots Mccrory Scholarship In Communication (Radio)
Scholarship for undergraduate students attending Southeastern Louisiana University full-time, majoring in Communication and planning to work in radio. Preference is given to the student workers of KSLU. Current students must have a minimum 2.5 GPA, however, beginning freshmen are required to have a minimum 3.0 GPA. Due date, number of awards and award amount varies. more...

Terrebonne Association For Family & Community Educations Jean Picou-Homemaker Council Scholarship
Annual award for an undergraduate student attending Nicholls State University full-time, majoring in Family and Consumer Sciences or Agriculture. Applicant must have a minimum 2.5 GPA. more...

Terrebonne Fine Arts Guild, Inc. Scholarship
Annual award for a resident of Terrebonne Parish, Louisiana who is a graduating high school senior accepted to Nicholls State University full-time, majoring in Fine Arts, Art Education or an Art-Related field. Recipient must maintain a 2.5 GPA with a 2.5 average in all arts courses. Award amount varies. more...

Terri Cropper Dembeck Scholarship
Annual award for graduating high school senior from Belle Chasse High School in Louisiana who has been accepted at Southeastern Louisiana University full-time. Applicant must submit a visionary essay on academic and long-term life goals. Due date varies. more...

Terrill And Henry Families Endowed Scholarship
Jimmy L. Terrill donated the “Terrill and Henry Families Scholarship” to Louisiana Tech University.
Selection Criteria:
Student must be registered and remain registered as a full-time student for the quarter in which he/she receives the scholarship at Louisiana Tech University.
Student must be majoring in an engineering curriculum.
Student must have a minimum 2.5 GPA. more...

Terry M. Cannon Memorial Scholarship
Scholarship for undergraduate or graduate students enrolled full-time at the University of Louisiana-Monroe majoring in Criminal Justice. Students must have a minimum 2.5 GPA. Deadlines and award amounts may vary. more...

Texaco Philanthropic Foundation Scholarship
Annual award for a undergraduate student attending Nicholls State University full-time. Renewable; four years or until baccalaureate degree requirements are completed, whichever occurs first. more...

The Bone And Joint Clinic Pre-Medical/Pre-Dental Scholarship
The Bone and Joint Clinic of Shreveport donated the “Bone and Joint Clinic Pre-Medical/Pre-Dental Scholarship” for students in the School of Biological Sciences majoring in Pre-Medical/Pre-Dental at Louisiana Tech University.
Selection Criteria:
Student must be Pre-Medical/Pre-Dental major.
Student must have financial need.
Student must have a minimum GPA of 3.0. more...

The James R. Harrelson Memorial Endowed Engineering Scholarship
Richard C. Harrelson donated “The James R. Harrelson Memorial Endowed Engineering Scholarship” to Louisiana Tech University.
Selection Criteria:
Student must have a minimum 3.0 GPA.
Student must have been accepted into the College of Engineering and Sciences.
Student must be registered and remain as a full-time student for the quarter in which he/she receives the scholarship at Louisiana Tech University.
1st preference: student must be a graduate of Woodlawn High School in Shreveport, Louisiana.
2nd preference: student must be a graduate of Fair Park High School in Shreveport, Louisiana.
3rd preference: any student that graduated from a high school in Caddo Parish. more...

The John H. "Slim" Scogin Memorial Scholarship In Mathematics
A. Recipient(s) may be a full time or part time student pursuing a degree in Mathematics.
B. The recipient(s) must have completed at least 60 hours in college courses.
C. The scholarship is renewable if a 3.0 GPA is maintained. The scholarship may be renewed for the remaining semesters required to complete a four year degree.
D. In the event there is no mathematics major who meets the criteria, the scholarship may be awarded to a computer science major with all other criteria remaining the same.
The Department of Mathematics & Physics or the Department of Computer Science will send recommended recipient(s) name(s) to the University of Louisiana at Monroe Scholarship Committee for final selection(s). Name of recipient(s) shall be forwarded to the ULM Scholarship Office as soon as selection is made. more...

The Kitty Degree Scholarship Endowment
The Kitty DeGree Scholarship Endowment was established in 1986 by Kitty DeGree to provide educational scholarships for deserving students.
1. Preference will be given to residents of Louisiana Baptist Children’s Home.
2. An incoming freshman must have a 3.0 GPA in high school and a minimum ACT score of 23.
3. Preference will be given to applicants in the following areas: Business, Education, Health Sciences, Construction, Natural and Physical Sciences.
4. Recipient(s) must maintain a 2.75 GPA to retain the scholarship.
5. Recipient(s) must exhibit good moral character. more...

The Lanette Southall Fisher Endowed Scholarship
Oberah M. Fisher donated “The Lanette Southall Fisher Endowed Scholarship” for students majoring in Elementary Education at Louisiana Tech University.
Selection Criteria:
The scholarship recipient will be chosen from Elementary Education majors within the College of Education, and chosen by the Scholarship Committee of the College of Education.
The student must be a Citizen of the U.S.A.
The recipient must remain enrolled in the College of Education in Elementary Education to qualify for continued funding. more...

The Louisiana Cancer Foundation For Research And Education, Llc Endowed Scholarship
To qualify for the scholarship a recipient must meet the following:
A. Students must be pursuing an undergraduate degree and meet the minimum requirements for acceptance into the University of Louisiana Monroe.
B. Preference is given to a student that is a documented cancer survivor or currently undergoing treatment for cancer.
C. Consideration will also be given to a student who has suffered a financial impact due to cancer in their immediately family (Father, Mother, Brother, Sister).
D. To qualify for consideration, an essay describing the impact of cancer on the student should be included in the application.
E. Scholarship is awarded on an annual basis only, but past recipients are eligible to re-apply.
F. Preference is given to a Louisiana resident.
Recipients of the Louisiana Cancer Foundation for Research and Education, LLC Scholarship will be recommended by the LCF Board of Directors. The recommendations will be sent to the University Scholarship Committee for final selection. The name of the recipient shall be forwarded to the ULM Scholarship office and the Louisiana Cancer Foundation Executive Director as soon as the selection is made. The selection will be based upon the amount of impact that cancer has had on the individual and the persuasiveness of the essay. Preference will be given to the documented cancer survivor and resident of Louisiana. more...

The Nikolas L. Lassiter Memorial Fund
To qualify for the scholarship, a recipient must meet the following:
A. Recipient(s) must be involved with the Student Government Association and/or a member of the Inter-fraternity Council fraternity or a Panhellenic sorority.
B. Recipient(s) must demonstrate leadership ability and be involved in meaningful extra-curricular activities which result in a better university community.
C. Recipient must have a 3.0 GPA to qualify for the scholarship and must maintain a 3.0 for renewal.
The Student Government Association Advisor will send recommended names to the University of Louisiana Monroe Scholarship Committee for final selection(s). more...

Oberah M. Fisher donated the “The Oliver W. Fisher Endowed Scholarship for Construction Engineering Technology” to Louisiana Tech University.

Student must be enrolled in the College of Engineering and Science majoring in Construction Engineering.
Student must be a citizen of the U.S.A.
The recipient must remain enrolled as a full-time student and be in good standing in the College of Engineering to qualify for continued funding.
Student must have a minimum 2.5 GPA. more...

The Robert H. And Harriet Bell Brooks And Mary Ann And Elizabeth Brooks Educational Endowed Scholarship
The James and Myrtle Brooks Living Trust donated “The Robert H. and Harriet Bell Brooks, and Mary Ann and Elizabeth Brooks Educational Endowment Scholarship” to Louisiana Tech University.
Selection Criteria:
Student must be registered and remain registered as a full-time student for the quarter in which he or she receives the scholarship at Louisiana Tech University.
Student must be enrolled as a Graduate student in an Engineering curriculum.
Student must maintain an overall 3.5 GPA on all official college graduate course work. more...

The Sharon Griffith Turrentine Endowed Scholarship For Women’s Entrepreneurship
The Endowment will be used to support the following:
A. A scholarship operating fund named the Jennie Clair Carroll Women in Leadership Scholarship.
B. The scholarship recipient(s) are awarded through the normal university scholarship selection process.
C. Recipient(s) must be a student enrolled at the University of Louisiana Monroe on a half-time basis or more in one of the programs that falls under the David and Sharon Turrentine School of Management.
D. Award(s) are reviewed annually but may be awarded to the same student for multiple years of his/her college career as long as a minimum 3.0 GPA is earned while under the scholarship award. However, the maximum length of time over which a student can receive the scholarship is four years.
E. Minimum criteria are identified above but preference will be given to students who meet one or more of the following criteria:
i. Student is a female from Ouachita Parish.
ii. Student has a cumulative 3.0 gpa.
iii. Student has financial need as demonstrated through the financial aid process, part-time to full-time employment, lack of other educational financial resources, etc.
iv. Student has demonstrated some leadership potential as evidenced by an involvement in some type of community, educational, or social group or organization.
The University of Louisiana Monroe Scholarship Committee or its normal scholarship selection process will select the Jennie Clair Carroll Women in Leadership Scholarship recipient. more...

Theatre Scholarship
This shall be awarded to a student major in the Division of Performing Arts, School of Theatre. To maintain eligibility the student must remain an active theatre major/minor, must participate in School of Theatre activities, and must remain academically in good standing.
The scholarship recipient must also review and sign a scholarship contract with the Director of Theatre. more...

Uncf Scholarships
UNCF is the nation’s largest private scholarship provider to minority group members. Each year, they award more than $100 million in scholarships to students attending more than 1,100 schools across the country, including our prestigious network of 37 HBCUs.
They also manage a variety of scholarship programs, such as the Fund II Foundation UNCF STEM Scholars Program, UNCF/Koch Scholars Program, K-12 Education Fellowship and the Frederick Douglass Bicentennial Scholarship Program. more...

Award must be used for living expenses only. Recipient cannot be receiving any other financial awards. Award amount varies. Renewable four years; maintain 3.0 GPA. more...

Whetstone Scholarship In Engineering
R. Terral Whetstone and American Electric Power donated the “Whetstone Scholarship in Engineering” to Louisiana Tech University.
Selection Criteria:
Student must be majoring in Mechanical Engineering.
Students must have accumulated at least 30 hours of credit.
Students must have a minimum and maintain a 2.5 GPA. more...

Whetstone Scholarship In Human Ecology
R. Terral Whetstone and American Electric Power donated the “Whetstone Scholarship in Home Economics” to Louisiana Tech University.
Selection Criteria:
Student must be majoring in the School of Human Ecology.
Student must be a sophomore class level.
Students must have and maintain a 3.0 GPA. more...

Wilbert J. Campbell, Jr. Memorial Scholarship
Semester award for undergraduate student attending Southeastern Louisiana University full-time, majoring in General Business with a concentration in Industrial Technology. Preference given to a Tangipahoa Parish resident. Applicant must have a minimum 3.0 GPA. Due date varies. more...

Wiley Hilburn Journalism Endowed Scholarship
The purpose of this scholarship is to acquire funds to assist in creating an endowment to fund scholarships in honor of Wiley W. Hilburn, Jr., who headed the Journalism department at Louisiana Tech University.
Selection Criteria:
The recipients(s) of the scholarship(s) will be majoring in Communication with a concentration in Communication Studies or Journalism.
Recipient must have a minimum GPA of 3.0 and be enrolled full-time for the quarter in which he/she receives the scholarship. more...

William And Sue Calgreen Engineering Scholarship
William and Sue Calgreen donated the “William and Sue Calgreen Engineering Scholarship” to Louisiana Tech University.
Selection Criteria:
Student must be registered and remain registered as a full-time student for the quarter in which he/she receives the scholarship at Louisiana Tech University.
Student must be within the College of Engineering and Science.
Student must have a minimum 2.5 GPA. more...

William C. Thurmon Endowed Scholarship
The Thurmon Family, L.L.C. represented by Virginia T. Thurmon and William C. Thurmon, Jr. donated the “William C. Thurmon Endowed Scholarship” to Louisiana Tech University.
Selection Criteria:
The scholarship recipient(s) must be registered and remain registered as a full-time student for the quarter in which he/she receives the scholarship at Louisiana Tech University.
Student must be in the College of Engineering and Science and majoring in Civil Engineering.
Scholarship recipient must maintain a minimum 2.5 GPA in all official college courses. more...

William D. Hoover Opportunity Scholarships
A. Opportunity scholarships are awarded at the direction of the Director for the William D. Hoover School of Accounting, Financial and Information Services, with approval by the Dean of the College of Business and Social Services
B. Opportunity scholarships will be used to selectively recruit, retain and provide educational opportunities (e.g., internship support) to students
C. Students must be currently pursuing completion of a degree or certificate in one of the programs under the William D. Hoover School of Accounting, Financial and Information Services at the University of Louisiana Monroe
D. These awards may be one semester or one-year awards and are not renewable without a complete reapplication for the scholarship
E. Preference will be given to those who have limited other financial resources at hand to help with educational/academic opportunities
F. Opportunity scholarships are limited to 15% of the annual earnings of the Endowment which will be transferred to the William D. Hoover Opportunity Scholarship more...

William F. Sherman Memorial Scholarship
The William F. Sherman Memorial Scholarship is available to students at Southeastern Louisiana University. You must be a senior, pre-med student. You must have completed at least 85 credit hours with a minimum 3.3 GPA and be in the process of applying to med school to be eligible for this award. more...

William Harry Tablot Endowment
William Harry Talbot’s family and M-I Drilling Fluids Company donated the "William Harry Talbot Endowment to Louisiana Tech University.
Selection Criteria:
Student must be registered and remain registered as a full-time student for the quarter in which he/she receives the scholarship at Louisiana Tech University.
Student must be majoring in an engineering curriculum.
Student must have a minimum 3.0 GPA.
Student must be a U.S. Citizen. more...

William Hodding Carter Scholarship
Annual award for undergraduate junior attending Southeastern Louisiana University. Award is presented in the Spring during the Student Affairs Awards Banquet. Applicant must have high academic standing (usually in top 1% of the class), and must exhibit outstanding university and community service. Due date varies. more...

William John Gilbert Memorial Fund
The William John Gilbert Memorial Fund is available to students at Loyola University, New Orleans. You must be majoring in business to qualify for this award. more...

William L. Duncan Memorial Scholarship
Annual award for an undergraduate student attending Nicholls State University full-time, who is a member of the University golf team. Applicant must have a minimum 2.0 GPA. The director of athletics at Nicholls shall submit the name of the recipient to the chairman of the University Scholarship Committee. more...

William M. Clarke Scholarship
The William M. Clarke Scholarship is available to full-time classics majors at Louisiana State University. You must have a minimum 3.0 overall GPA and a minimum 3.3 GPA in classics, must have completed one year of residence at LSU, and demonstrate significant progress toward a degree in classics to be eligible for this award. more...

2. Student must have completed at least 30 hours
3. Student must have a 3.0 GPA
4. Student must demonstrate financial need more...

Willie Fletcher Endowed Scholarship
Lucius D. McGehee, Sr. and Mildred T. McGehee donated the “Willie Fletcher Endowed Scholarship in the Department of Human Ecology” to Louisiana Tech University.
Selection Criteria:
The recipient must have met the requirements for admission to the graduate program.
The scholarship recipient(s) must be registered and remain registered as a full-time student for the quarter in which he/she receives the scholarship at Louisiana Tech University.
The recipient must have demonstrated leadership ability, shown participation in University and School of Human Ecology activities, and must have a 3.0 or better GPA in undergraduate work.
Student must maintain an overall 3.0 GPA as an average on all official college course work. more...

Willis & Mildred Pellerin Scholarship
Annual award for an undergraduate student attending Nicholls State University full-time. Applicant must have a minimum 2.5 GPA and an ACT score of 20 or above. Candidate must have demonstrated financial need. Award amount varies. more...

Willis M. And Lillene M. Herring Pre-Nursing Endowed Scholarship
1. Student should be from Minden or Webster Parish
2. Student must be have a pre-nursing tract
3. Student must demonstrate financial need
4. Student must be enrolled full-time for year of award
5. Student must have a 2.75 GPA
6. Other students may be considered if there are no eligible students from Webster Parish more...

Woodrow J. Defelice Memorial Scholarship
Annual award for a resident of Lafourche Parish, Louisiana who is a graduating high school senior accepted to Nicholls State University full-time. Applicant must have strong academic and leadership achievements, as well as a minimum 3.0 GPA. Candidate must have financial need and an ACT score of at least 22. Award amount varies. Renewable; maintain 2.5 GPA. more...

2. Student must have earned at least 30 hours
3. Student must be enrolled full-time
4. Student must have a minimum cumulative GPA of 3.0 more...

Scholarship(s) shall be awarded to a student majoring in English.
The scholarship recipient must maintain a minimum 3.0 GPA in all official college courses. more...
